# ProdBot AI Chatbot for PMs Context Starter

{
  "product": "ProdBot - AI Product Management Assistant",
  "regions": "United States", "EU and UK", "India"
  "segment": "Product Managers and Product Leaders at B2B SaaS companies",
  "specialty": "product management",
  "price_assumption": 200,
  "currency": "USD",
  "time_horizon_years": 1,
  "notes": "Productside is developing an AI-powered chatbot assistant that helps Product Managers accelerate market research, problem decomposition, and strategic analysis. The ProdBot integrates with common PM tools (Jira, Confluence, ProductBoard), maintains conversation context across sessions, and generates reusable workflow templates for TAM/SAM/SOM analysis, persona development, and opportunity mapping. Primary customers are individual PMs and PM teams at growth-stage B2B SaaS companies (50-500 employees) seeking to 10x their productivity without expensive consulting engagements. Adoption barriers include concerns about proprietary data sharing, existing free ChatGPT usage creating 'good enough' alternatives, prompt engineering learning curve, and skepticism about AI-generated strategic artifacts. Competitive landscape includes PM-specific chatbots (i.e. LennyBot, Teresa Torres' AI Interview Coach, ChatPRD, Kraftful, etc.), generic AI assistants with PM prompt libraries (ChatGPT, Claude), and PM tools embedding AI features (ProductBoard AI, Aha! Intelligence). Productside seeks to quantify the addressable market of practicing PMs in the U.S. to validate product-market fit and establish Year 1 revenue targets for an individual subscription model at $200/year per PM."
}

import json
import re

from langchain_core.tools import StructuredTool
from pydantic import ValidationError

from langflow.base.agents.agent import LCToolsAgentComponent
from langflow.base.agents.events import ExceptionWithMessageError
from langflow.base.models.model_input_constants import (
    ALL_PROVIDER_FIELDS,
    MODEL_DYNAMIC_UPDATE_FIELDS,
    MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT,
    MODELS_METADATA,
)
from langflow.base.models.model_utils import get_model_name
from langflow.components.helpers.current_date import CurrentDateComponent
from langflow.components.helpers.memory import MemoryComponent
from langflow.components.langchain_utilities.tool_calling import (
    ToolCallingAgentComponent,
)
from langflow.custom.custom_component.component import _get_component_toolkit
from langflow.custom.utils import update_component_build_config
from langflow.field_typing import Tool
from langflow.helpers.base_model import build_model_from_schema
from langflow.io import (
    BoolInput,
    DropdownInput,
    IntInput,
    MultilineInput,
    Output,
    TableInput,
)
from langflow.logging import logger
from langflow.schema.data import Data
from langflow.schema.dotdict import dotdict
from langflow.schema.message import Message
from langflow.schema.table import EditMode


def set_advanced_true(component_input):
    component_input.advanced = True
    return component_input


MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST = ["Anthropic", "Google Generative AI", "OpenAI"]


class AgentComponent(ToolCallingAgentComponent):
    display_name: str = "Agent"
    description: str = "Define the agent's instructions, then enter a task to complete using tools."
    documentation: str = "https://docs.langflow.org/agents"
    icon = "bot"
    beta = False
    name = "Agent"

    memory_inputs = [set_advanced_true(component_input) for component_input in MemoryComponent().inputs]

    # Filter out json_mode from OpenAI inputs since we handle structured output differently
    openai_inputs_filtered = [
        input_field
        for input_field in MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT["OpenAI"]["inputs"]
        if not (hasattr(input_field, "name") and input_field.name == "json_mode")
    ]

    inputs = [
        DropdownInput(
            name="agent_llm",
            display_name="Model Provider",
            info="The provider of the language model that the agent will use to generate responses.",
            options=[*MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST],
            value="OpenAI",
            real_time_refresh=True,
            refresh_button=False,
            input_types=[],
            options_metadata=[MODELS_METADATA[key] for key in MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST],
            external_options={
                "fields": {
                    "data": {
                        "node": {
                            "name": "connect_other_models",
                            "display_name": "Connect other models",
                            "icon": "CornerDownLeft",
                        }
                    }
                },
            },
        ),
        *openai_inputs_filtered,
        MultilineInput(
            name="system_prompt",
            display_name="Agent Instructions",
            info="System Prompt: Initial instructions and context provided to guide the agent's behavior.",
            value="You are a helpful assistant that can use tools to answer questions and perform tasks.",
            advanced=False,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="n_messages",
            display_name="Number of Chat History Messages",
            value=100,
            info="Number of chat history messages to retrieve.",
            advanced=True,
            show=True,
        ),
        MultilineInput(
            name="format_instructions",
            display_name="Output Format Instructions",
            info="Generic Template for structured output formatting. Valid only with Structured response.",
            value=(
                "You are an AI that extracts structured JSON objects from unstructured text. "
                "Use a predefined schema with expected types (str, int, float, bool, dict). "
                "Extract ALL relevant instances that match the schema - if multiple patterns exist, capture them all. "
                "Fill missing or ambiguous values with defaults: null for missing values. "
                "Remove exact duplicates but keep variations that have different field values. "
                "Always return valid JSON in the expected format, never throw errors. "
                "If multiple objects can be extracted, return them all in the structured format."
            ),
            advanced=True,
        ),
        TableInput(
            name="output_schema",
            display_name="Output Schema",
            info=(
                "Schema Validation: Define the structure and data types for structured output. "
                "No validation if no output schema."
            ),
            advanced=True,
            required=False,
            value=[],
            table_schema=[
                {
                    "name": "name",
                    "display_name": "Name",
                    "type": "str",
                    "description": "Specify the name of the output field.",
                    "default": "field",
                    "edit_mode": EditMode.INLINE,
                },
                {
                    "name": "description",
                    "display_name": "Description",
                    "type": "str",
                    "description": "Describe the purpose of the output field.",
                    "default": "description of field",
                    "edit_mode": EditMode.POPOVER,
                },
                {
                    "name": "type",
                    "display_name": "Type",
                    "type": "str",
                    "edit_mode": EditMode.INLINE,
                    "description": ("Indicate the data type of the output field (e.g., str, int, float, bool, dict)."),
                    "options": ["str", "int", "float", "bool", "dict"],
                    "default": "str",
                },
                {
                    "name": "multiple",
                    "display_name": "As List",
                    "type": "boolean",
                    "description": "Set to True if this output field should be a list of the specified type.",
                    "default": "False",
                    "edit_mode": EditMode.INLINE,
                },
            ],
        ),
        *LCToolsAgentComponent._base_inputs,
        # removed memory inputs from agent component
        # *memory_inputs,
        BoolInput(
            name="add_current_date_tool",
            display_name="Current Date",
            advanced=True,
            info="If true, will add a tool to the agent that returns the current date.",
            value=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(name="response", display_name="Response", method="message_response"),
    ]

    async def get_agent_requirements(self):
        """Get the agent requirements for the agent."""
        llm_model, display_name = await self.get_llm()
        if llm_model is None:
            msg = "No language model selected. Please choose a model to proceed."
            raise ValueError(msg)
        self.model_name = get_model_name(llm_model, display_name=display_name)

        # Get memory data
        self.chat_history = await self.get_memory_data()
        if isinstance(self.chat_history, Message):
            self.chat_history = [self.chat_history]

        # Add current date tool if enabled
        if self.add_current_date_tool:
            if not isinstance(self.tools, list):  # type: ignore[has-type]
                self.tools = []
            current_date_tool = (await CurrentDateComponent(**self.get_base_args()).to_toolkit()).pop(0)
            if not isinstance(current_date_tool, StructuredTool):
                msg = "CurrentDateComponent must be converted to a StructuredTool"
                raise TypeError(msg)
            self.tools.append(current_date_tool)
        return llm_model, self.chat_history, self.tools

    async def message_response(self) -> Message:
        try:
            llm_model, self.chat_history, self.tools = await self.get_agent_requirements()
            # Set up and run agent
            self.set(
                llm=llm_model,
                tools=self.tools or [],
                chat_history=self.chat_history,
                input_value=self.input_value,
                system_prompt=self.system_prompt,
            )
            agent = self.create_agent_runnable()
            result = await self.run_agent(agent)

            # Store result for potential JSON output
            self._agent_result = result

        except (ValueError, TypeError, KeyError) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"{type(e).__name__}: {e!s}")
            raise
        except ExceptionWithMessageError as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"ExceptionWithMessageError occurred: {e}")
            raise
        # Avoid catching blind Exception; let truly unexpected exceptions propagate
        except Exception as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Unexpected error: {e!s}")
            raise
        else:
            return result

    def _preprocess_schema(self, schema):
        """Preprocess schema to ensure correct data types for build_model_from_schema."""
        processed_schema = []
        for field in schema:
            processed_field = {
                "name": str(field.get("name", "field")),
                "type": str(field.get("type", "str")),
                "description": str(field.get("description", "")),
                "multiple": field.get("multiple", False),
            }
            # Ensure multiple is handled correctly
            if isinstance(processed_field["multiple"], str):
                processed_field["multiple"] = processed_field["multiple"].lower() in [
                    "true",
                    "1",
                    "t",
                    "y",
                    "yes",
                ]
            processed_schema.append(processed_field)
        return processed_schema

    async def build_structured_output_base(self, content: str):
        """Build structured output with optional BaseModel validation."""
        json_pattern = r"\{.*\}"
        schema_error_msg = "Try setting an output schema"

        # Try to parse content as JSON first
        json_data = None
        try:
            json_data = json.loads(content)
        except json.JSONDecodeError:
            json_match = re.search(json_pattern, content, re.DOTALL)
            if json_match:
                try:
                    json_data = json.loads(json_match.group())
                except json.JSONDecodeError:
                    return {"content": content, "error": schema_error_msg}
            else:
                return {"content": content, "error": schema_error_msg}

        # If no output schema provided, return parsed JSON without validation
        if not hasattr(self, "output_schema") or not self.output_schema or len(self.output_schema) == 0:
            return json_data

        # Use BaseModel validation with schema
        try:
            processed_schema = self._preprocess_schema(self.output_schema)
            output_model = build_model_from_schema(processed_schema)

            # Validate against the schema
            if isinstance(json_data, list):
                # Multiple objects
                validated_objects = []
                for item in json_data:
                    try:
                        validated_obj = output_model.model_validate(item)
                        validated_objects.append(validated_obj.model_dump())
                    except ValidationError as e:
                        await logger.aerror(f"Validation error for item: {e}")
                        # Include invalid items with error info
                        validated_objects.append({"data": item, "validation_error": str(e)})
                return validated_objects

            # Single object
            try:
                validated_obj = output_model.model_validate(json_data)
                return [validated_obj.model_dump()]  # Return as list for consistency
            except ValidationError as e:
                await logger.aerror(f"Validation error: {e}")
                return [{"data": json_data, "validation_error": str(e)}]

        except (TypeError, ValueError) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Error building structured output: {e}")
            # Fallback to parsed JSON without validation
            return json_data

    async def json_response(self) -> Data:
        """Convert agent response to structured JSON Data output with schema validation."""
        # Always use structured chat agent for JSON response mode for better JSON formatting
        try:
            system_components = []

            # 1. Agent Instructions (system_prompt)
            agent_instructions = getattr(self, "system_prompt", "") or ""
            if agent_instructions:
                system_components.append(f"{agent_instructions}")

            # 2. Format Instructions
            format_instructions = getattr(self, "format_instructions", "") or ""
            if format_instructions:
                system_components.append(f"Format instructions: {format_instructions}")

            # 3. Schema Information from BaseModel
            if hasattr(self, "output_schema") and self.output_schema and len(self.output_schema) > 0:
                try:
                    processed_schema = self._preprocess_schema(self.output_schema)
                    output_model = build_model_from_schema(processed_schema)
                    schema_dict = output_model.model_json_schema()
                    schema_info = (
                        "You are given some text that may include format instructions, "
                        "explanations, or other content alongside a JSON schema.\n\n"
                        "Your task:\n"
                        "- Extract only the JSON schema.\n"
                        "- Return it as valid JSON.\n"
                        "- Do not include format instructions, explanations, or extra text.\n\n"
                        "Input:\n"
                        f"{json.dumps(schema_dict, indent=2)}\n\n"
                        "Output (only JSON schema):"
                    )
                    system_components.append(schema_info)
                except (ValidationError, ValueError, TypeError, KeyError) as e:
                    await logger.aerror(f"Could not build schema for prompt: {e}", exc_info=True)

            # Combine all components
            combined_instructions = "\n\n".join(system_components) if system_components else ""
            llm_model, self.chat_history, self.tools = await self.get_agent_requirements()
            self.set(
                llm=llm_model,
                tools=self.tools or [],
                chat_history=self.chat_history,
                input_value=self.input_value,
                system_prompt=combined_instructions,
            )

            # Create and run structured chat agent
            try:
                structured_agent = self.create_agent_runnable()
            except (NotImplementedError, ValueError, TypeError) as e:
                await logger.aerror(f"Error with structured chat agent: {e}")
                raise
            try:
                result = await self.run_agent(structured_agent)
            except (
                ExceptionWithMessageError,
                ValueError,
                TypeError,
                RuntimeError,
            ) as e:
                await logger.aerror(f"Error with structured agent result: {e}")
                raise
            # Extract content from structured agent result
            if hasattr(result, "content"):
                content = result.content
            elif hasattr(result, "text"):
                content = result.text
            else:
                content = str(result)

        except (
            ExceptionWithMessageError,
            ValueError,
            TypeError,
            NotImplementedError,
            AttributeError,
        ) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Error with structured chat agent: {e}")
            # Fallback to regular agent
            content_str = "No content returned from agent"
            return Data(data={"content": content_str, "error": str(e)})

        # Process with structured output validation
        try:
            structured_output = await self.build_structured_output_base(content)

            # Handle different output formats
            if isinstance(structured_output, list) and structured_output:
                if len(structured_output) == 1:
                    return Data(data=structured_output[0])
                return Data(data={"results": structured_output})
            if isinstance(structured_output, dict):
                return Data(data=structured_output)
            return Data(data={"content": content})

        except (ValueError, TypeError) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Error in structured output processing: {e}")
            return Data(data={"content": content, "error": str(e)})

    async def get_memory_data(self):
        # TODO: This is a temporary fix to avoid message duplication. We should develop a function for this.
        messages = (
            await MemoryComponent(**self.get_base_args())
            .set(
                session_id=self.graph.session_id,
                order="Ascending",
                n_messages=self.n_messages,
            )
            .retrieve_messages()
        )
        return [
            message for message in messages if getattr(message, "id", None) != getattr(self.input_value, "id", None)
        ]

    async def get_llm(self):
        if not isinstance(self.agent_llm, str):
            return self.agent_llm, None

        try:
            provider_info = MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT.get(self.agent_llm)
            if not provider_info:
                msg = f"Invalid model provider: {self.agent_llm}"
                raise ValueError(msg)

            component_class = provider_info.get("component_class")
            display_name = component_class.display_name
            inputs = provider_info.get("inputs")
            prefix = provider_info.get("prefix", "")

            return self._build_llm_model(component_class, inputs, prefix), display_name

        except (AttributeError, ValueError, TypeError, RuntimeError) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Error building {self.agent_llm} language model: {e!s}")
            msg = f"Failed to initialize language model: {e!s}"
            raise ValueError(msg) from e

    def _build_llm_model(self, component, inputs, prefix=""):
        model_kwargs = {}
        for input_ in inputs:
            if hasattr(self, f"{prefix}{input_.name}"):
                model_kwargs[input_.name] = getattr(self, f"{prefix}{input_.name}")
        return component.set(**model_kwargs).build_model()

    def set_component_params(self, component):
        provider_info = MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT.get(self.agent_llm)
        if provider_info:
            inputs = provider_info.get("inputs")
            prefix = provider_info.get("prefix")
            # Filter out json_mode and only use attributes that exist on this component
            model_kwargs = {}
            for input_ in inputs:
                if hasattr(self, f"{prefix}{input_.name}"):
                    model_kwargs[input_.name] = getattr(self, f"{prefix}{input_.name}")

            return component.set(**model_kwargs)
        return component

    def delete_fields(self, build_config: dotdict, fields: dict | list[str]) -> None:
        """Delete specified fields from build_config."""
        for field in fields:
            build_config.pop(field, None)

    def update_input_types(self, build_config: dotdict) -> dotdict:
        """Update input types for all fields in build_config."""
        for key, value in build_config.items():
            if isinstance(value, dict):
                if value.get("input_types") is None:
                    build_config[key]["input_types"] = []
            elif hasattr(value, "input_types") and value.input_types is None:
                value.input_types = []
        return build_config

    async def update_build_config(
        self, build_config: dotdict, field_value: str, field_name: str | None = None
    ) -> dotdict:
        # Iterate over all providers in the MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT
        # Existing logic for updating build_config
        if field_name in ("agent_llm",):
            build_config["agent_llm"]["value"] = field_value
            provider_info = MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT.get(field_value)
            if provider_info:
                component_class = provider_info.get("component_class")
                if component_class and hasattr(component_class, "update_build_config"):
                    # Call the component class's update_build_config method
                    build_config = await update_component_build_config(
                        component_class, build_config, field_value, "model_name"
                    )

            provider_configs: dict[str, tuple[dict, list[dict]]] = {
                provider: (
                    MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT[provider]["fields"],
                    [
                        MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT[other_provider]["fields"]
                        for other_provider in MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT
                        if other_provider != provider
                    ],
                )
                for provider in MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT
            }
            if field_value in provider_configs:
                fields_to_add, fields_to_delete = provider_configs[field_value]

                # Delete fields from other providers
                for fields in fields_to_delete:
                    self.delete_fields(build_config, fields)

                # Add provider-specific fields
                if field_value == "OpenAI" and not any(field in build_config for field in fields_to_add):
                    build_config.update(fields_to_add)
                else:
                    build_config.update(fields_to_add)
                # Reset input types for agent_llm
                build_config["agent_llm"]["input_types"] = []
                build_config["agent_llm"]["display_name"] = "Model Provider"
            elif field_value == "connect_other_models":
                # Delete all provider fields
                self.delete_fields(build_config, ALL_PROVIDER_FIELDS)
                # # Update with custom component
                custom_component = DropdownInput(
                    name="agent_llm",
                    display_name="Language Model",
                    info="The provider of the language model that the agent will use to generate responses.",
                    options=[*MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST],
                    real_time_refresh=True,
                    refresh_button=False,
                    input_types=["LanguageModel"],
                    placeholder="Awaiting model input.",
                    options_metadata=[MODELS_METADATA[key] for key in MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST],
                    external_options={
                        "fields": {
                            "data": {
                                "node": {
                                    "name": "connect_other_models",
                                    "display_name": "Connect other models",
                                    "icon": "CornerDownLeft",
                                },
                            }
                        },
                    },
                )
                build_config.update({"agent_llm": custom_component.to_dict()})
            # Update input types for all fields
            build_config = self.update_input_types(build_config)

            # Validate required keys
            default_keys = [
                "code",
                "_type",
                "agent_llm",
                "tools",
                "input_value",
                "add_current_date_tool",
                "system_prompt",
                "agent_description",
                "max_iterations",
                "handle_parsing_errors",
                "verbose",
            ]
            missing_keys = [key for key in default_keys if key not in build_config]
            if missing_keys:
                msg = f"Missing required keys in build_config: {missing_keys}"
                raise ValueError(msg)
        if (
            isinstance(self.agent_llm, str)
            and self.agent_llm in MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT
            and field_name in MODEL_DYNAMIC_UPDATE_FIELDS
        ):
            provider_info = MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT.get(self.agent_llm)
            if provider_info:
                component_class = provider_info.get("component_class")
                component_class = self.set_component_params(component_class)
                prefix = provider_info.get("prefix")
                if component_class and hasattr(component_class, "update_build_config"):
                    # Call each component class's update_build_config method
                    # remove the prefix from the field_name
                    if isinstance(field_name, str) and isinstance(prefix, str):
                        field_name = field_name.replace(prefix, "")
                    build_config = await update_component_build_config(
                        component_class, build_config, field_value, "model_name"
                    )
        return dotdict({k: v.to_dict() if hasattr(v, "to_dict") else v for k, v in build_config.items()})

    async def _get_tools(self) -> list[Tool]:
        component_toolkit = _get_component_toolkit()
        tools_names = self._build_tools_names()
        agent_description = self.get_tool_description()
        # TODO: Agent Description Depreciated Feature to be removed
        description = f"{agent_description}{tools_names}"
        tools = component_toolkit(component=self).get_tools(
            tool_name="Call_Agent",
            tool_description=description,
            callbacks=self.get_langchain_callbacks(),
        )
        if hasattr(self, "tools_metadata"):
            tools = component_toolkit(component=self, metadata=self.tools_metadata).update_tools_metadata(tools=tools)
        return tools

format_instructions.info: Generic Template for structured output formatting. Valid only with Structured response.
format_instructions.name: format_instructions
format_instructions.value: You are an AI that extracts structured JSON objects from unstructured text. Use a predefined schema with expected types (str, int, float, bool, dict). Extract ALL relevant instances that match the schema - if multiple patterns exist, capture them all. Fill missing or ambiguous values with defaults: null for missing values. Remove exact duplicates but keep variations that have different field values. Always return valid JSON in the expected format, never throw errors. If multiple objects can be extracted, return them all in the structured format.

handle_parsing_errors.info: Should the Agent fix errors when reading user input for better processing?
handle_parsing_errors.name: handle_parsing_errors

input_value.info: The input provided by the user for the agent to process.
input_value.name: input_value

json_mode.info: If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.
json_mode.name: json_mode

max_iterations.info: The maximum number of attempts the agent can make to complete its task before it stops.
max_iterations.name: max_iterations

max_retries.info: The maximum number of retries to make when generating.
max_retries.name: max_retries

max_tokens.info: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.
max_tokens.name: max_tokens

model_kwargs.info: Additional keyword arguments to pass to the model.
model_kwargs.name: model_kwargs

model_name.info: To see the model names, first choose a provider. Then, enter your API key and click the refresh button next to the model name.
model_name.name: model_name

n_messages.info: Number of chat history messages to retrieve.
n_messages.name: n_messages

system_prompt.info: System Prompt: Initial instructions and context provided to guide the agent's behavior.

system_prompt.value:
# Langflow Agent 1 of 3 - Total Addressable Market

I am an autonomous agent acting as a research agent on behalf of a product manager.
You must NEVER prompt, ask questions, or seek clarification from the user for any reason.
If a value is unknown, use your best judgement and clearly state assumptions.

Based on the context provided,
for each region identified in {{regions}},
within the defined {{segment}},
specializing in {{specialty}},
use authoritative data and your best judgement to identify the approximate Total Addressable Market (TAM).

CRITICAL: Parse {{regions}} to extract ALL geographic regions mentioned (could be states, countries, or "United States"). 
Create a separate TAM analysis for EACH region found.

## Source Citation Requirements

You MUST cite authoritative sources for EVERY quantitative claim.

For each data point (population counts, market sizes, percentages), you must:
1. Provide specific URL citations (not just "Census Bureau" - actual URLs)
2. Prioritize primary sources over secondary aggregators
3. State data quality explicitly: Primary source / Secondary analysis / Interpolation
4. When interpolating or estimating, show your reasoning step-by-step

## Data Sources by Priority

Primary sources (prioritize):
- U.S.: census.gov, bls.gov, cms.gov, state agencies, industry associations
- Europe: ec.europa.eu/eurostat, national statistical agencies
- Global: worldbank.org, imf.org

Secondary sources (use to validate):
- statista.com, ibisworld.com, marketresearch.com, pewresearch.org, gartner.com

## TAM Calculation Methodology

TAM = Population Data × Qualification Criteria × Price Assumption

CRITICAL: Calculate each region INDEPENDENTLY. Do NOT carry filters or calculations from one region to another. Each region starts fresh with its own population base.

For each region, you must:

1. Identify total population of entities IN THIS REGION ONLY (e.g., all medical practices, all PMs at companies)
   - Source: [Specific URL]
   - Data quality: [Primary / Secondary / Interpolated]
   - Start fresh for each region - do not subtract previous regions

2. Apply qualification filters TO THIS REGION'S POPULATION (e.g., specialty, size, technology readiness, job role)
   - Filter 1: [Description] → [X%] of THIS REGION's population qualifies (Source: [URL])
   - Filter 2: [Description] → [Y%] of remaining population qualifies (Source: [URL])
   - Qualified population: [Number] ([Z%] of THIS REGION's total)
   - Filters apply ONLY to this region, not globally

3. Calculate economic value (THIS REGION's qualified population × price)
   - Pricing assumption: $[Amount] per customer per year
   - Source for pricing: [URL or reasoning if estimated]

4. Assess confidence based on data quality FOR THIS REGION
   - High: Primary sources, recent data (<2 years old)
   - Medium: Secondary sources or slightly dated primary (2-4 years)
   - Low: Interpolated or extrapolated from proxy data

Example calculation flow for 3 regions:
- Region 1: 100K total → 60% qualify → 60K TAM for Region 1
- Region 2: 80K total → 55% qualify → 44K TAM for Region 2  
- Region 3: 120K total → 65% qualify → 78K TAM for Region 3
- TOTAL TAM: 60K + 44K + 78K = 182K (NOT 60K applied across all regions)

## Output Format

Output one YAML document only (no commentary, no explanations).

~~~yaml
context:
  product: "{{product}}"
  regions: "{{regions}}"
  segment: "{{segment}}"
  specialty: "{{specialty}}"
  price_assumption: {{price_assumption}}
  currency: "{{currency}}"
  time_horizon_years: {{time_horizon_years}}

regions:
  # DYNAMICALLY GENERATE ONE ENTRY PER REGION FOUND IN {{regions}}
  
  - name: "[Region Name from {{regions}}]"
    tam:
      population:
        total_entities: 0
        total_entities_source: "https://specific-url-here"
        qualified_entities: 0
        qualification_filters:
          - filter: "[Description of filter]"
            percentage: "0%"
            source: "https://specific-url-here"
          - filter: "[Description of filter]"
            percentage: "0%"
            source: "https://specific-url-here"
      economics:
        value: 0
        currency: "{{currency}}"
        calculation: "[qualified_entities] × $[price_assumption]"
        pricing_source: "https://specific-url-here OR [reasoning]"
      data_quality: "Primary / Secondary / Interpolated"
      sources: 
        - "https://full-url-1"
        - "https://full-url-2"
      reasoning: "1-2 sentence explanation showing calculation steps"
      assumptions: 
        - "key assumption 1"
        - "key assumption 2"
      confidence: "High / Medium / Low"
      confidence_rationale: "1 sentence explaining confidence"
  
  # REPEAT FOR EACH ADDITIONAL REGION FOUND IN {{regions}}

summary:
  total_entities: 0  # MUST equal: SUM of qualified_entities from ALL regions (not total_entities, not an average)
  aggregate_tam_value: 0  # MUST equal: SUM of economics.value from ALL regions
  currency: "{{currency}}"
  data_quality_overall: "High / Medium / Low"
  primary_sources_count: 0  # Count of regions using Primary data_quality
  secondary_sources_count: 0  # Count of regions using Secondary data_quality

# VERIFICATION STEPS - Follow these before outputting summary:
# 1. List out each region's qualified_entities value
# 2. Add them together with a calculator (show your work)
# 3. Put the sum in summary.total_entities
# 4. List out each region's economics.value
# 5. Add them together with a calculator (show your work)
# 6. Put the sum in summary.aggregate_tam_value
#
# CRITICAL CALCULATION EXAMPLE:
# If you have 3 regions with these qualified_entities:
#   Region 1: qualified_entities = 16,940
#   Region 2: qualified_entities = 24,000
#   Region 3: qualified_entities = 16,000
# Then summary.total_entities MUST be: 16,940 + 24,000 + 16,000 = 56,940
#
# If you have 3 regions with these economics.value:
#   Region 1: value = 3,388,000
#   Region 2: value = 4,800,000
#   Region 3: value = 3,200,000
# Then summary.aggregate_tam_value MUST be: 3,388,000 + 4,800,000 + 3,200,000 = 11,388,000
#
# DO NOT subtract, average, or apply any other operation. ONLY addition.

handoff_to_sam:
  # DYNAMICALLY GENERATE ONE ENTRY PER REGION
  
  - region: "[Region Name]"
    tam_entities: 0
    tam_value: 0
    confidence: "High / Medium / Low"
  
  # REPEAT FOR EACH ADDITIONAL REGION
~~~

## Example: Healthcare Product (Multi-State)

Input: regions="North Carolina, Tennessee, Virginia"
Output: 3 separate analyses

~~~yaml
regions:
  - name: "North Carolina"
    tam:
      population:
        total_entities: 487
        total_entities_source: "https://ncmedboard.org/cardiology-directory-2024"
        qualified_entities: 146
        qualification_filters:
          - filter: "Active clinical trial participation"
            percentage: "35%"
            source: "https://clinicaltrials.gov/state-participation-2024"
          - filter: "Independent or hospital-affiliated"
            percentage: "85%"
            source: "https://acc.org/practice-census-2024"
      economics:
        value: 7300000
        currency: "USD"
        calculation: "146 practices × $50,000"
        pricing_source: "https://appliedclinicaltrialsonline.com/pricing-survey"
      data_quality: "Primary"
      sources:
        - "https://ncmedboard.org/cardiology-directory-2024"
        - "https://clinicaltrials.gov/state-participation-2024"
      reasoning: "487 practices → 35% with trials (170) → 85% non-academic (146)"
      assumptions:
        - "All non-academic practices with trials are potential customers"
        - "Pricing based on comparable trial software platforms"
      confidence: "High"
      confidence_rationale: "Primary sources from state board and national registry, <12 months old"
~~~

## Example: Software Product (National)

Input: regions="United States"
Output: 1 national analysis

~~~yaml
regions:
  - name: "United States"
    tam:
      population:
        total_entities: 847000
        total_entities_source: "https://www.bls.gov/oes/current/oes113061.htm"
        qualified_entities: 84700
        qualification_filters:
          - filter: "Working at B2B SaaS companies"
            percentage: "22%"
            source: "https://productmanagementfestival.com/state-of-pm-2024"
          - filter: "Companies with 50-500 employees"
            percentage: "45%"
            source: "https://census.gov/programs-surveys/susb/data.html"
      economics:
        value: 16940000
        currency: "USD"
        calculation: "84,700 PMs × $200"
        pricing_source: "Individual SaaS subscriptions typically $15-30/month"
      data_quality: "Primary"
      sources:
        - "https://www.bls.gov/oes/current/oes113061.htm"
        - "https://census.gov/programs-surveys/susb/data.html"
      reasoning: "847K PMs → 22% at B2B SaaS (186K) → 45% at growth-stage (84.7K)"
      assumptions:
        - "All PMs at growth-stage B2B SaaS are potential customers"
        - "$200/year aligns with individual tool budgets"
      confidence: "Medium"
      confidence_rationale: "BLS primary, but SaaS segmentation from survey (secondary)"
~~~

## Constraints

- NEVER prompt or ask questions
- NEVER output commentary outside YAML
- ALWAYS cite specific URLs for every data point
- ALWAYS show qualification filtering logic
- ALWAYS parse {{regions}} dynamically
- ALWAYS calculate each region independently (do NOT apply one region's filters to another)
- ALWAYS sum regional qualified_entities and economics.value in summary using simple addition
- NEVER subtract, average, weight, or apply any operation other than addition to summary totals
- Keep reasoning to 1-2 sentences per section
- Valid YAML matching schema above
- If interpolating, state explicitly in data_quality field

code.value:
import json
import re

from langchain_core.tools import StructuredTool
from pydantic import ValidationError

from langflow.base.agents.agent import LCToolsAgentComponent
from langflow.base.agents.events import ExceptionWithMessageError
from langflow.base.models.model_input_constants import (
    ALL_PROVIDER_FIELDS,
    MODEL_DYNAMIC_UPDATE_FIELDS,
    MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT,
    MODELS_METADATA,
)
from langflow.base.models.model_utils import get_model_name
from langflow.components.helpers.current_date import CurrentDateComponent
from langflow.components.helpers.memory import MemoryComponent
from langflow.components.langchain_utilities.tool_calling import (
    ToolCallingAgentComponent,
)
from langflow.custom.custom_component.component import _get_component_toolkit
from langflow.custom.utils import update_component_build_config
from langflow.field_typing import Tool
from langflow.helpers.base_model import build_model_from_schema
from langflow.io import (
    BoolInput,
    DropdownInput,
    IntInput,
    MultilineInput,
    Output,
    TableInput,
)
from langflow.logging import logger
from langflow.schema.data import Data
from langflow.schema.dotdict import dotdict
from langflow.schema.message import Message
from langflow.schema.table import EditMode


def set_advanced_true(component_input):
    component_input.advanced = True
    return component_input


MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST = ["Anthropic", "Google Generative AI", "OpenAI"]


class AgentComponent(ToolCallingAgentComponent):
    display_name: str = "Agent"
    description: str = "Define the agent's instructions, then enter a task to complete using tools."
    documentation: str = "https://docs.langflow.org/agents"
    icon = "bot"
    beta = False
    name = "Agent"

    memory_inputs = [set_advanced_true(component_input) for component_input in MemoryComponent().inputs]

    # Filter out json_mode from OpenAI inputs since we handle structured output differently
    openai_inputs_filtered = [
        input_field
        for input_field in MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT["OpenAI"]["inputs"]
        if not (hasattr(input_field, "name") and input_field.name == "json_mode")
    ]

    inputs = [
        DropdownInput(
            name="agent_llm",
            display_name="Model Provider",
            info="The provider of the language model that the agent will use to generate responses.",
            options=[*MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST],
            value="OpenAI",
            real_time_refresh=True,
            refresh_button=False,
            input_types=[],
            options_metadata=[MODELS_METADATA[key] for key in MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST],
            external_options={
                "fields": {
                    "data": {
                        "node": {
                            "name": "connect_other_models",
                            "display_name": "Connect other models",
                            "icon": "CornerDownLeft",
                        }
                    }
                },
            },
        ),
        *openai_inputs_filtered,
        MultilineInput(
            name="system_prompt",
            display_name="Agent Instructions",
            info="System Prompt: Initial instructions and context provided to guide the agent's behavior.",
            value="You are a helpful assistant that can use tools to answer questions and perform tasks.",
            advanced=False,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="n_messages",
            display_name="Number of Chat History Messages",
            value=100,
            info="Number of chat history messages to retrieve.",
            advanced=True,
            show=True,
        ),
        MultilineInput(
            name="format_instructions",
            display_name="Output Format Instructions",
            info="Generic Template for structured output formatting. Valid only with Structured response.",
            value=(
                "You are an AI that extracts structured JSON objects from unstructured text. "
                "Use a predefined schema with expected types (str, int, float, bool, dict). "
                "Extract ALL relevant instances that match the schema - if multiple patterns exist, capture them all. "
                "Fill missing or ambiguous values with defaults: null for missing values. "
                "Remove exact duplicates but keep variations that have different field values. "
                "Always return valid JSON in the expected format, never throw errors. "
                "If multiple objects can be extracted, return them all in the structured format."
            ),
            advanced=True,
        ),
        TableInput(
            name="output_schema",
            display_name="Output Schema",
            info=(
                "Schema Validation: Define the structure and data types for structured output. "
                "No validation if no output schema."
            ),
            advanced=True,
            required=False,
            value=[],
            table_schema=[
                {
                    "name": "name",
                    "display_name": "Name",
                    "type": "str",
                    "description": "Specify the name of the output field.",
                    "default": "field",
                    "edit_mode": EditMode.INLINE,
                },
                {
                    "name": "description",
                    "display_name": "Description",
                    "type": "str",
                    "description": "Describe the purpose of the output field.",
                    "default": "description of field",
                    "edit_mode": EditMode.POPOVER,
                },
                {
                    "name": "type",
                    "display_name": "Type",
                    "type": "str",
                    "edit_mode": EditMode.INLINE,
                    "description": ("Indicate the data type of the output field (e.g., str, int, float, bool, dict)."),
                    "options": ["str", "int", "float", "bool", "dict"],
                    "default": "str",
                },
                {
                    "name": "multiple",
                    "display_name": "As List",
                    "type": "boolean",
                    "description": "Set to True if this output field should be a list of the specified type.",
                    "default": "False",
                    "edit_mode": EditMode.INLINE,
                },
            ],
        ),
        *LCToolsAgentComponent._base_inputs,
        # removed memory inputs from agent component
        # *memory_inputs,
        BoolInput(
            name="add_current_date_tool",
            display_name="Current Date",
            advanced=True,
            info="If true, will add a tool to the agent that returns the current date.",
            value=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(name="response", display_name="Response", method="message_response"),
    ]

    async def get_agent_requirements(self):
        """Get the agent requirements for the agent."""
        llm_model, display_name = await self.get_llm()
        if llm_model is None:
            msg = "No language model selected. Please choose a model to proceed."
            raise ValueError(msg)
        self.model_name = get_model_name(llm_model, display_name=display_name)

        # Get memory data
        self.chat_history = await self.get_memory_data()
        if isinstance(self.chat_history, Message):
            self.chat_history = [self.chat_history]

        # Add current date tool if enabled
        if self.add_current_date_tool:
            if not isinstance(self.tools, list):  # type: ignore[has-type]
                self.tools = []
            current_date_tool = (await CurrentDateComponent(**self.get_base_args()).to_toolkit()).pop(0)
            if not isinstance(current_date_tool, StructuredTool):
                msg = "CurrentDateComponent must be converted to a StructuredTool"
                raise TypeError(msg)
            self.tools.append(current_date_tool)
        return llm_model, self.chat_history, self.tools

    async def message_response(self) -> Message:
        try:
            llm_model, self.chat_history, self.tools = await self.get_agent_requirements()
            # Set up and run agent
            self.set(
                llm=llm_model,
                tools=self.tools or [],
                chat_history=self.chat_history,
                input_value=self.input_value,
                system_prompt=self.system_prompt,
            )
            agent = self.create_agent_runnable()
            result = await self.run_agent(agent)

            # Store result for potential JSON output
            self._agent_result = result

        except (ValueError, TypeError, KeyError) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"{type(e).__name__}: {e!s}")
            raise
        except ExceptionWithMessageError as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"ExceptionWithMessageError occurred: {e}")
            raise
        # Avoid catching blind Exception; let truly unexpected exceptions propagate
        except Exception as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Unexpected error: {e!s}")
            raise
        else:
            return result

    def _preprocess_schema(self, schema):
        """Preprocess schema to ensure correct data types for build_model_from_schema."""
        processed_schema = []
        for field in schema:
            processed_field = {
                "name": str(field.get("name", "field")),
                "type": str(field.get("type", "str")),
                "description": str(field.get("description", "")),
                "multiple": field.get("multiple", False),
            }
            # Ensure multiple is handled correctly
            if isinstance(processed_field["multiple"], str):
                processed_field["multiple"] = processed_field["multiple"].lower() in [
                    "true",
                    "1",
                    "t",
                    "y",
                    "yes",
                ]
            processed_schema.append(processed_field)
        return processed_schema

    async def build_structured_output_base(self, content: str):
        """Build structured output with optional BaseModel validation."""
        json_pattern = r"\{.*\}"
        schema_error_msg = "Try setting an output schema"

        # Try to parse content as JSON first
        json_data = None
        try:
            json_data = json.loads(content)
        except json.JSONDecodeError:
            json_match = re.search(json_pattern, content, re.DOTALL)
            if json_match:
                try:
                    json_data = json.loads(json_match.group())
                except json.JSONDecodeError:
                    return {"content": content, "error": schema_error_msg}
            else:
                return {"content": content, "error": schema_error_msg}

        # If no output schema provided, return parsed JSON without validation
        if not hasattr(self, "output_schema") or not self.output_schema or len(self.output_schema) == 0:
            return json_data

        # Use BaseModel validation with schema
        try:
            processed_schema = self._preprocess_schema(self.output_schema)
            output_model = build_model_from_schema(processed_schema)

            # Validate against the schema
            if isinstance(json_data, list):
                # Multiple objects
                validated_objects = []
                for item in json_data:
                    try:
                        validated_obj = output_model.model_validate(item)
                        validated_objects.append(validated_obj.model_dump())
                    except ValidationError as e:
                        await logger.aerror(f"Validation error for item: {e}")
                        # Include invalid items with error info
                        validated_objects.append({"data": item, "validation_error": str(e)})
                return validated_objects

            # Single object
            try:
                validated_obj = output_model.model_validate(json_data)
                return [validated_obj.model_dump()]  # Return as list for consistency
            except ValidationError as e:
                await logger.aerror(f"Validation error: {e}")
                return [{"data": json_data, "validation_error": str(e)}]

        except (TypeError, ValueError) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Error building structured output: {e}")
            # Fallback to parsed JSON without validation
            return json_data

    async def json_response(self) -> Data:
        """Convert agent response to structured JSON Data output with schema validation."""
        # Always use structured chat agent for JSON response mode for better JSON formatting
        try:
            system_components = []

            # 1. Agent Instructions (system_prompt)
            agent_instructions = getattr(self, "system_prompt", "") or ""
            if agent_instructions:
                system_components.append(f"{agent_instructions}")

            # 2. Format Instructions
            format_instructions = getattr(self, "format_instructions", "") or ""
            if format_instructions:
                system_components.append(f"Format instructions: {format_instructions}")

            # 3. Schema Information from BaseModel
            if hasattr(self, "output_schema") and self.output_schema and len(self.output_schema) > 0:
                try:
                    processed_schema = self._preprocess_schema(self.output_schema)
                    output_model = build_model_from_schema(processed_schema)
                    schema_dict = output_model.model_json_schema()
                    schema_info = (
                        "You are given some text that may include format instructions, "
                        "explanations, or other content alongside a JSON schema.\n\n"
                        "Your task:\n"
                        "- Extract only the JSON schema.\n"
                        "- Return it as valid JSON.\n"
                        "- Do not include format instructions, explanations, or extra text.\n\n"
                        "Input:\n"
                        f"{json.dumps(schema_dict, indent=2)}\n\n"
                        "Output (only JSON schema):"
                    )
                    system_components.append(schema_info)
                except (ValidationError, ValueError, TypeError, KeyError) as e:
                    await logger.aerror(f"Could not build schema for prompt: {e}", exc_info=True)

            # Combine all components
            combined_instructions = "\n\n".join(system_components) if system_components else ""
            llm_model, self.chat_history, self.tools = await self.get_agent_requirements()
            self.set(
                llm=llm_model,
                tools=self.tools or [],
                chat_history=self.chat_history,
                input_value=self.input_value,
                system_prompt=combined_instructions,
            )

            # Create and run structured chat agent
            try:
                structured_agent = self.create_agent_runnable()
            except (NotImplementedError, ValueError, TypeError) as e:
                await logger.aerror(f"Error with structured chat agent: {e}")
                raise
            try:
                result = await self.run_agent(structured_agent)
            except (
                ExceptionWithMessageError,
                ValueError,
                TypeError,
                RuntimeError,
            ) as e:
                await logger.aerror(f"Error with structured agent result: {e}")
                raise
            # Extract content from structured agent result
            if hasattr(result, "content"):
                content = result.content
            elif hasattr(result, "text"):
                content = result.text
            else:
                content = str(result)

        except (
            ExceptionWithMessageError,
            ValueError,
            TypeError,
            NotImplementedError,
            AttributeError,
        ) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Error with structured chat agent: {e}")
            # Fallback to regular agent
            content_str = "No content returned from agent"
            return Data(data={"content": content_str, "error": str(e)})

        # Process with structured output validation
        try:
            structured_output = await self.build_structured_output_base(content)

            # Handle different output formats
            if isinstance(structured_output, list) and structured_output:
                if len(structured_output) == 1:
                    return Data(data=structured_output[0])
                return Data(data={"results": structured_output})
            if isinstance(structured_output, dict):
                return Data(data=structured_output)
            return Data(data={"content": content})

        except (ValueError, TypeError) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Error in structured output processing: {e}")
            return Data(data={"content": content, "error": str(e)})

    async def get_memory_data(self):
        # TODO: This is a temporary fix to avoid message duplication. We should develop a function for this.
        messages = (
            await MemoryComponent(**self.get_base_args())
            .set(
                session_id=self.graph.session_id,
                order="Ascending",
                n_messages=self.n_messages,
            )
            .retrieve_messages()
        )
        return [
            message for message in messages if getattr(message, "id", None) != getattr(self.input_value, "id", None)
        ]

    async def get_llm(self):
        if not isinstance(self.agent_llm, str):
            return self.agent_llm, None

        try:
            provider_info = MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT.get(self.agent_llm)
            if not provider_info:
                msg = f"Invalid model provider: {self.agent_llm}"
                raise ValueError(msg)

            component_class = provider_info.get("component_class")
            display_name = component_class.display_name
            inputs = provider_info.get("inputs")
            prefix = provider_info.get("prefix", "")

            return self._build_llm_model(component_class, inputs, prefix), display_name

        except (AttributeError, ValueError, TypeError, RuntimeError) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Error building {self.agent_llm} language model: {e!s}")
            msg = f"Failed to initialize language model: {e!s}"
            raise ValueError(msg) from e

    def _build_llm_model(self, component, inputs, prefix=""):
        model_kwargs = {}
        for input_ in inputs:
            if hasattr(self, f"{prefix}{input_.name}"):
                model_kwargs[input_.name] = getattr(self, f"{prefix}{input_.name}")
        return component.set(**model_kwargs).build_model()

    def set_component_params(self, component):
        provider_info = MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT.get(self.agent_llm)
        if provider_info:
            inputs = provider_info.get("inputs")
            prefix = provider_info.get("prefix")
            # Filter out json_mode and only use attributes that exist on this component
            model_kwargs = {}
            for input_ in inputs:
                if hasattr(self, f"{prefix}{input_.name}"):
                    model_kwargs[input_.name] = getattr(self, f"{prefix}{input_.name}")

            return component.set(**model_kwargs)
        return component

    def delete_fields(self, build_config: dotdict, fields: dict | list[str]) -> None:
        """Delete specified fields from build_config."""
        for field in fields:
            build_config.pop(field, None)

    def update_input_types(self, build_config: dotdict) -> dotdict:
        """Update input types for all fields in build_config."""
        for key, value in build_config.items():
            if isinstance(value, dict):
                if value.get("input_types") is None:
                    build_config[key]["input_types"] = []
            elif hasattr(value, "input_types") and value.input_types is None:
                value.input_types = []
        return build_config

    async def update_build_config(
        self, build_config: dotdict, field_value: str, field_name: str | None = None
    ) -> dotdict:
        # Iterate over all providers in the MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT
        # Existing logic for updating build_config
        if field_name in ("agent_llm",):
            build_config["agent_llm"]["value"] = field_value
            provider_info = MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT.get(field_value)
            if provider_info:
                component_class = provider_info.get("component_class")
                if component_class and hasattr(component_class, "update_build_config"):
                    # Call the component class's update_build_config method
                    build_config = await update_component_build_config(
                        component_class, build_config, field_value, "model_name"
                    )

            provider_configs: dict[str, tuple[dict, list[dict]]] = {
                provider: (
                    MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT[provider]["fields"],
                    [
                        MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT[other_provider]["fields"]
                        for other_provider in MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT
                        if other_provider != provider
                    ],
                )
                for provider in MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT
            }
            if field_value in provider_configs:
                fields_to_add, fields_to_delete = provider_configs[field_value]

                # Delete fields from other providers
                for fields in fields_to_delete:
                    self.delete_fields(build_config, fields)

                # Add provider-specific fields
                if field_value == "OpenAI" and not any(field in build_config for field in fields_to_add):
                    build_config.update(fields_to_add)
                else:
                    build_config.update(fields_to_add)
                # Reset input types for agent_llm
                build_config["agent_llm"]["input_types"] = []
                build_config["agent_llm"]["display_name"] = "Model Provider"
            elif field_value == "connect_other_models":
                # Delete all provider fields
                self.delete_fields(build_config, ALL_PROVIDER_FIELDS)
                # # Update with custom component
                custom_component = DropdownInput(
                    name="agent_llm",
                    display_name="Language Model",
                    info="The provider of the language model that the agent will use to generate responses.",
                    options=[*MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST],
                    real_time_refresh=True,
                    refresh_button=False,
                    input_types=["LanguageModel"],
                    placeholder="Awaiting model input.",
                    options_metadata=[MODELS_METADATA[key] for key in MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST],
                    external_options={
                        "fields": {
                            "data": {
                                "node": {
                                    "name": "connect_other_models",
                                    "display_name": "Connect other models",
                                    "icon": "CornerDownLeft",
                                },
                            }
                        },
                    },
                )
                build_config.update({"agent_llm": custom_component.to_dict()})
            # Update input types for all fields
            build_config = self.update_input_types(build_config)

            # Validate required keys
            default_keys = [
                "code",
                "_type",
                "agent_llm",
                "tools",
                "input_value",
                "add_current_date_tool",
                "system_prompt",
                "agent_description",
                "max_iterations",
                "handle_parsing_errors",
                "verbose",
            ]
            missing_keys = [key for key in default_keys if key not in build_config]
            if missing_keys:
                msg = f"Missing required keys in build_config: {missing_keys}"
                raise ValueError(msg)
        if (
            isinstance(self.agent_llm, str)
            and self.agent_llm in MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT
            and field_name in MODEL_DYNAMIC_UPDATE_FIELDS
        ):
            provider_info = MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT.get(self.agent_llm)
            if provider_info:
                component_class = provider_info.get("component_class")
                component_class = self.set_component_params(component_class)
                prefix = provider_info.get("prefix")
                if component_class and hasattr(component_class, "update_build_config"):
                    # Call each component class's update_build_config method
                    # remove the prefix from the field_name
                    if isinstance(field_name, str) and isinstance(prefix, str):
                        field_name = field_name.replace(prefix, "")
                    build_config = await update_component_build_config(
                        component_class, build_config, field_value, "model_name"
                    )
        return dotdict({k: v.to_dict() if hasattr(v, "to_dict") else v for k, v in build_config.items()})

    async def _get_tools(self) -> list[Tool]:
        component_toolkit = _get_component_toolkit()
        tools_names = self._build_tools_names()
        agent_description = self.get_tool_description()
        # TODO: Agent Description Depreciated Feature to be removed
        description = f"{agent_description}{tools_names}"
        tools = component_toolkit(component=self).get_tools(
            tool_name="Call_Agent",
            tool_description=description,
            callbacks=self.get_langchain_callbacks(),
        )
        if hasattr(self, "tools_metadata"):
            tools = component_toolkit(component=self, metadata=self.tools_metadata).update_tools_metadata(tools=tools)
        return tools

system_prompt.value:
# Langflow Agent 2 of 3 - Serviceable Available Market

I am an autonomous agent acting as a research agent on behalf of a product manager.
You must NEVER prompt, ask questions, or seek clarification from the user for any reason.
Use your best judgement and authoritative reasoning only.

You will receive TAM data with a compressed "handoff_to_sam" section containing TAM summaries.

For each region:
- Calculate the Serviceable Available Market (SAM)
- SAM = portion of TAM realistically reachable in Year {{time_horizon_years}}
- Apply reachability filters (geographic, technology, competitive, channel)
- Show cumulative filtering with sources for each filter

## SAM Formula

SAM = TAM × Reachability Filters

Reachability constraints include:
- Geographic: Sales territory, regulatory boundaries, physical reach
- Technology: Integration requirements, infrastructure readiness, tech stack compatibility
- Competitive: Contract lock-in, switching costs, incumbent advantage
- Channel: Partner coverage, distribution reach, access constraints

## Source Requirements

MUST provide for every filter:
- Specific URL citation (not just "industry reports")
- Percentage impact of filter on remaining TAM
- Data quality: Primary / Secondary / Interpolated
- Reasoning for filter percentage

Primary sources: Industry associations, market research firms, competitive intelligence
Secondary sources: News articles, analyst reports, company blogs

## SAM Calculation Process

CRITICAL: Calculate each region INDEPENDENTLY. Do NOT carry filters or percentages from one region to another. Each region starts with its own TAM from the handoff.

For each region:
1. Start with THIS REGION's TAM (from handoff_to_sam)
2. Apply Filter 1 TO THIS REGION → Calculate remaining population for this region
3. Apply Filter 2 TO THIS REGION → Calculate remaining population for this region
4. Apply Filter 3 TO THIS REGION → Calculate remaining population for this region
5. Final SAM = THIS REGION's remaining population after all filters
6. Show cumulative impact at each step FOR THIS REGION ONLY

Example calculation flow for 3 regions:
- Region 1: TAM=16,940 → Filter 1 (60% remain)=10,164 → Filter 2 (50% remain)=5,082 → Filter 3 (70% remain)=3,557 SAM
- Region 2: TAM=24,000 → Filter 1 (60% remain)=14,400 → Filter 2 (50% remain)=7,200 → Filter 3 (70% remain)=5,040 SAM
- Region 3: TAM=16,000 → Filter 1 (60% remain)=9,600 → Filter 2 (50% remain)=4,800 → Filter 3 (70% remain)=3,360 SAM
- TOTAL SAM: 3,557 + 5,040 + 3,360 = 11,957 (NOT 3,557 applied to all regions)

## Output Format

Output one YAML document only (no commentary, no explanations).

~~~yaml
context:
  specialty: "{{specialty}}"
  time_horizon_years: {{time_horizon_years}}
  currency: "{{currency}}"

tam_summary:
  # Reference data from handoff_to_sam
  - region: "[Region Name]"
    tam_entities: 0
    tam_value: 0

regions:
  # ONE ENTRY PER REGION FROM HANDOFF
  
  - name: "[Region Name]"
    sam:
      starting_tam:
        entities: 0
        value: 0
      reachability_filters:
        - filter: "[Filter Name]"
          impact: "Excludes X% of TAM"
          remaining_entities: 0
          remaining_value: 0
          reasoning: "1-2 sentences explaining filter"
          source: "https://specific-url"
        - filter: "[Filter Name]"
          impact: "Excludes X% of remaining"
          remaining_entities: 0
          remaining_value: 0
          reasoning: "1-2 sentences"
          source: "https://specific-url"
        - filter: "[Filter Name]"
          impact: "Excludes X% of remaining"
          remaining_entities: 0
          remaining_value: 0
          reasoning: "1-2 sentences"
          source: "https://specific-url"
      final_sam:
        reachable_entities: 0
        reachable_percentage_of_tam: "0%"
        sam_value: 0
        sam_percentage_of_tam_value: "0%"
        currency: "{{currency}}"
      data_quality: "Primary / Secondary / Interpolated"
      sources: ["https://url1", "https://url2"]
      reasoning: "1-2 sentences on overall reachability"
      assumptions: ["assumption 1", "assumption 2"]
      confidence: "High / Medium / Low"
      confidence_rationale: "1 sentence"

summary:
  sam_total_entities: 0  # MUST equal: SUM of final_sam.reachable_entities from ALL regions
  sam_total_value: 0  # MUST equal: SUM of final_sam.sam_value from ALL regions
  currency: "{{currency}}"
  average_sam_percentage_of_tam: "0%"  # Calculate: (sam_total_entities / original_tam_total_entities) × 100%

# VERIFICATION STEPS - Follow these before outputting summary:
# 1. List out each region's final_sam.reachable_entities value
# 2. Add them together with a calculator (show your work)
# 3. Put the sum in summary.sam_total_entities
# 4. List out each region's final_sam.sam_value
# 5. Add them together with a calculator (show your work)
# 6. Put the sum in summary.sam_total_value
#
# CRITICAL CALCULATION EXAMPLE:
# If you have 3 regions with these final_sam.reachable_entities:
#   Region 1: reachable_entities = 10,164
#   Region 2: reachable_entities = 14,400
#   Region 3: reachable_entities = 9,600
# Then summary.sam_total_entities MUST be: 10,164 + 14,400 + 9,600 = 34,164
#
# If you have 3 regions with these final_sam.sam_value:
#   Region 1: sam_value = 2,032,800
#   Region 2: sam_value = 2,880,000
#   Region 3: sam_value = 1,920,000
# Then summary.sam_total_value MUST be: 2,032,800 + 2,880,000 + 1,920,000 = 6,832,800
#
# DO NOT subtract, average, or apply any other operation. ONLY addition.

handoff_to_som:
  # ONE ENTRY PER REGION
  
  - region: "[Region Name]"
    tam_entities: 0
    tam_value: 0
    sam_entities: 0
    sam_value: 0
    confidence: "High / Medium / Low"
~~~

## Example: Healthcare Product (Multi-State)

Input from TAM: NC=146 practices ($7.3M), TN=118 practices ($5.9M), VA=187 practices ($9.35M)

~~~yaml
regions:
  - name: "North Carolina"
    sam:
      starting_tam:
        entities: 146
        value: 7300000
      reachability_filters:
        - filter: "Geographic reach - sales territory"
          impact: "Excludes 25% (rural areas outside metro coverage)"
          remaining_entities: 110
          remaining_value: 5475000
          reasoning: "Sales team covers Charlotte, Raleigh, Greensboro metros only"
          source: "https://nccommerce.com/metro-area-business-density-2024"
        - filter: "Technology compatibility - EHR integration"
          impact: "Excludes 30% (incompatible EHR systems)"
          remaining_entities: 77
          remaining_value: 3832500
          reasoning: "Product requires Epic or Cerner; 70% of practices use compatible systems"
          source: "https://klasresearch.com/ehr-market-share-2024"
        - filter: "Competitive lock-in - existing contracts"
          impact: "Excludes 20% (multi-year competitor contracts)"
          remaining_entities: 62
          remaining_value: 3066000
          reasoning: "Estimated 20% locked into 2-3 year contracts with incumbents"
          source: "Market intelligence from competitive sales calls"
      final_sam:
        reachable_entities: 62
        reachable_percentage_of_tam: "42%"
        sam_value: 3066000
        sam_percentage_of_tam_value: "42%"
        currency: "USD"
      data_quality: "Primary"
      sources:
        - "https://nccommerce.com/metro-area-business-density-2024"
        - "https://klasresearch.com/ehr-market-share-2024"
      reasoning: "Three-stage filtering: geography (75% remain) → tech (70% of remainder) → competitive (80% of remainder) = 42% of TAM reachable"
      assumptions:
        - "Rural practices outside sales territory are unreachable in Year 1"
        - "EHR compatibility is binary requirement (no workarounds)"
        - "Competitor contracts average 2-3 year terms with early termination penalties"
      confidence: "Medium"
      confidence_rationale: "Primary data for geography and tech, but competitive intelligence is estimated"
~~~

## Example: Software Product (National)

Input from TAM: US=84,700 PMs ($16.94M)

~~~yaml
regions:
  - name: "United States"
    sam:
      starting_tam:
        entities: 84700
        value: 16940000
      reachability_filters:
        - filter: "Marketing reach - digital channels"
          impact: "Excludes 40% (outside marketing funnel)"
          remaining_entities: 50820
          remaining_value: 10164000
          reasoning: "Digital marketing reaches 60% of target PMs through PM communities, LinkedIn, conferences"
          source: "https://productmanagementfestival.com/pm-digital-behavior-2024"
        - filter: "Product awareness - existing free alternatives"
          impact: "Excludes 50% (satisfied with free ChatGPT)"
          remaining_entities: 25410
          remaining_value: 5082000
          reasoning: "50% of PMs currently using free ChatGPT see no reason to switch"
          source: "https://productboard.com/state-of-product-management-tools-2024"
        - filter: "Budget authority - individual purchasing power"
          impact: "Excludes 30% (no discretionary budget)"
          remaining_entities: 17787
          remaining_value: 3557400
          reasoning: "70% of PMs have $200+ discretionary tool budget without approval"
          source: "https://lennysnewsletter.com/pm-tool-spending-survey-2024"
      final_sam:
        reachable_entities: 17787
        reachable_percentage_of_tam: "21%"
        sam_value: 3557400
        sam_percentage_of_tam_value: "21%"
        currency: "USD"
      data_quality: "Secondary"
      sources:
        - "https://productmanagementfestival.com/pm-digital-behavior-2024"
        - "https://productboard.com/state-of-product-management-tools-2024"
        - "https://lennysnewsletter.com/pm-tool-spending-survey-2024"
      reasoning: "Three-stage filtering: marketing reach (60%) → awareness/switching (50% of remainder) → budget (70% of remainder) = 21% of TAM reachable"
      assumptions:
        - "Marketing can effectively reach 60% of target PMs through known channels"
        - "Free alternatives create 50% attrition at awareness stage"
        - "Individual PMs have $200 discretionary budget for tools"
      confidence: "Medium"
      confidence_rationale: "Relies on secondary survey data for behavior and budget assumptions"
~~~

## Constraints

- DO NOT reproduce full TAM data from previous agent (reference via handoff only)
- NEVER prompt or ask questions
- NEVER output commentary outside YAML
- ALWAYS cite specific URLs for filter percentages
- ALWAYS show cumulative filtering (not just final SAM)
- ALWAYS calculate each region's SAM independently (do NOT apply one region's filters to another)
- ALWAYS sum regional final_sam.reachable_entities and final_sam.sam_value in summary using simple addition
- NEVER subtract, average, weight, or apply any operation other than addition to summary totals
- Keep reasoning to 1-2 sentences per field
- Valid YAML only
- Dynamic regions - match whatever regions came from TAM handoff
- If data unavailable, make reasonable assumption and list under "assumptions"
