import json
import re

from langchain_core.tools import StructuredTool
from pydantic import ValidationError

from langflow.base.agents.agent import LCToolsAgentComponent
from langflow.base.agents.events import ExceptionWithMessageError
from langflow.base.models.model_input_constants import (
    ALL_PROVIDER_FIELDS,
    MODEL_DYNAMIC_UPDATE_FIELDS,
    MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT,
    MODELS_METADATA,
)
from langflow.base.models.model_utils import get_model_name
from langflow.components.helpers.current_date import CurrentDateComponent
from langflow.components.helpers.memory import MemoryComponent
from langflow.components.langchain_utilities.tool_calling import (
    ToolCallingAgentComponent,
)
from langflow.custom.custom_component.component import _get_component_toolkit
from langflow.custom.utils import update_component_build_config
from langflow.field_typing import Tool
from langflow.helpers.base_model import build_model_from_schema
from langflow.io import (
    BoolInput,
    DropdownInput,
    IntInput,
    MultilineInput,
    Output,
    TableInput,
)
from langflow.logging import logger
from langflow.schema.data import Data
from langflow.schema.dotdict import dotdict
from langflow.schema.message import Message
from langflow.schema.table import EditMode


def set_advanced_true(component_input):
    component_input.advanced = True
    return component_input


MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST = ["Anthropic", "Google Generative AI", "OpenAI"]


class AgentComponent(ToolCallingAgentComponent):
    display_name: str = "Agent"
    description: str = "Define the agent's instructions, then enter a task to complete using tools."
    documentation: str = "https://docs.langflow.org/agents"
    icon = "bot"
    beta = False
    name = "Agent"

    memory_inputs = [set_advanced_true(component_input) for component_input in MemoryComponent().inputs]

    # Filter out json_mode from OpenAI inputs since we handle structured output differently
    openai_inputs_filtered = [
        input_field
        for input_field in MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT["OpenAI"]["inputs"]
        if not (hasattr(input_field, "name") and input_field.name == "json_mode")
    ]

    inputs = [
        DropdownInput(
            name="agent_llm",
            display_name="Model Provider",
            info="The provider of the language model that the agent will use to generate responses.",
            options=[*MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST],
            value="OpenAI",
            real_time_refresh=True,
            refresh_button=False,
            input_types=[],
            options_metadata=[MODELS_METADATA[key] for key in MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST],
            external_options={
                "fields": {
                    "data": {
                        "node": {
                            "name": "connect_other_models",
                            "display_name": "Connect other models",
                            "icon": "CornerDownLeft",
                        }
                    }
                },
            },
        ),
        *openai_inputs_filtered,
        MultilineInput(
            name="system_prompt",
            display_name="Agent Instructions",
            info="System Prompt: Initial instructions and context provided to guide the agent's behavior.",
            value="You are a helpful assistant that can use tools to answer questions and perform tasks.",
            advanced=False,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="n_messages",
            display_name="Number of Chat History Messages",
            value=100,
            info="Number of chat history messages to retrieve.",
            advanced=True,
            show=True,
        ),
        MultilineInput(
            name="format_instructions",
            display_name="Output Format Instructions",
            info="Generic Template for structured output formatting. Valid only with Structured response.",
            value=(
                "You are an AI that extracts structured JSON objects from unstructured text. "
                "Use a predefined schema with expected types (str, int, float, bool, dict). "
                "Extract ALL relevant instances that match the schema - if multiple patterns exist, capture them all. "
                "Fill missing or ambiguous values with defaults: null for missing values. "
                "Remove exact duplicates but keep variations that have different field values. "
                "Always return valid JSON in the expected format, never throw errors. "
                "If multiple objects can be extracted, return them all in the structured format."
            ),
            advanced=True,
        ),
        TableInput(
            name="output_schema",
            display_name="Output Schema",
            info=(
                "Schema Validation: Define the structure and data types for structured output. "
                "No validation if no output schema."
            ),
            advanced=True,
            required=False,
            value=[],
            table_schema=[
                {
                    "name": "name",
                    "display_name": "Name",
                    "type": "str",
                    "description": "Specify the name of the output field.",
                    "default": "field",
                    "edit_mode": EditMode.INLINE,
                },
                {
                    "name": "description",
                    "display_name": "Description",
                    "type": "str",
                    "description": "Describe the purpose of the output field.",
                    "default": "description of field",
                    "edit_mode": EditMode.POPOVER,
                },
                {
                    "name": "type",
                    "display_name": "Type",
                    "type": "str",
                    "edit_mode": EditMode.INLINE,
                    "description": ("Indicate the data type of the output field (e.g., str, int, float, bool, dict)."),
                    "options": ["str", "int", "float", "bool", "dict"],
                    "default": "str",
                },
                {
                    "name": "multiple",
                    "display_name": "As List",
                    "type": "boolean",
                    "description": "Set to True if this output field should be a list of the specified type.",
                    "default": "False",
                    "edit_mode": EditMode.INLINE,
                },
            ],
        ),
        *LCToolsAgentComponent._base_inputs,
        # removed memory inputs from agent component
        # *memory_inputs,
        BoolInput(
            name="add_current_date_tool",
            display_name="Current Date",
            advanced=True,
            info="If true, will add a tool to the agent that returns the current date.",
            value=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(name="response", display_name="Response", method="message_response"),
    ]

    async def get_agent_requirements(self):
        """Get the agent requirements for the agent."""
        llm_model, display_name = await self.get_llm()
        if llm_model is None:
            msg = "No language model selected. Please choose a model to proceed."
            raise ValueError(msg)
        self.model_name = get_model_name(llm_model, display_name=display_name)

        # Get memory data
        self.chat_history = await self.get_memory_data()
        if isinstance(self.chat_history, Message):
            self.chat_history = [self.chat_history]

        # Add current date tool if enabled
        if self.add_current_date_tool:
            if not isinstance(self.tools, list):  # type: ignore[has-type]
                self.tools = []
            current_date_tool = (await CurrentDateComponent(**self.get_base_args()).to_toolkit()).pop(0)
            if not isinstance(current_date_tool, StructuredTool):
                msg = "CurrentDateComponent must be converted to a StructuredTool"
                raise TypeError(msg)
            self.tools.append(current_date_tool)
        return llm_model, self.chat_history, self.tools

    async def message_response(self) -> Message:
        try:
            llm_model, self.chat_history, self.tools = await self.get_agent_requirements()
            # Set up and run agent
            self.set(
                llm=llm_model,
                tools=self.tools or [],
                chat_history=self.chat_history,
                input_value=self.input_value,
                system_prompt=self.system_prompt,
            )
            agent = self.create_agent_runnable()
            result = await self.run_agent(agent)

            # Store result for potential JSON output
            self._agent_result = result

        except (ValueError, TypeError, KeyError) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"{type(e).__name__}: {e!s}")
            raise
        except ExceptionWithMessageError as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"ExceptionWithMessageError occurred: {e}")
            raise
        # Avoid catching blind Exception; let truly unexpected exceptions propagate
        except Exception as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Unexpected error: {e!s}")
            raise
        else:
            return result

    def _preprocess_schema(self, schema):
        """Preprocess schema to ensure correct data types for build_model_from_schema."""
        processed_schema = []
        for field in schema:
            processed_field = {
                "name": str(field.get("name", "field")),
                "type": str(field.get("type", "str")),
                "description": str(field.get("description", "")),
                "multiple": field.get("multiple", False),
            }
            # Ensure multiple is handled correctly
            if isinstance(processed_field["multiple"], str):
                processed_field["multiple"] = processed_field["multiple"].lower() in [
                    "true",
                    "1",
                    "t",
                    "y",
                    "yes",
                ]
            processed_schema.append(processed_field)
        return processed_schema

    async def build_structured_output_base(self, content: str):
        """Build structured output with optional BaseModel validation."""
        json_pattern = r"\{.*\}"
        schema_error_msg = "Try setting an output schema"

        # Try to parse content as JSON first
        json_data = None
        try:
            json_data = json.loads(content)
        except json.JSONDecodeError:
            json_match = re.search(json_pattern, content, re.DOTALL)
            if json_match:
                try:
                    json_data = json.loads(json_match.group())
                except json.JSONDecodeError:
                    return {"content": content, "error": schema_error_msg}
            else:
                return {"content": content, "error": schema_error_msg}

        # If no output schema provided, return parsed JSON without validation
        if not hasattr(self, "output_schema") or not self.output_schema or len(self.output_schema) == 0:
            return json_data

        # Use BaseModel validation with schema
        try:
            processed_schema = self._preprocess_schema(self.output_schema)
            output_model = build_model_from_schema(processed_schema)

            # Validate against the schema
            if isinstance(json_data, list):
                # Multiple objects
                validated_objects = []
                for item in json_data:
                    try:
                        validated_obj = output_model.model_validate(item)
                        validated_objects.append(validated_obj.model_dump())
                    except ValidationError as e:
                        await logger.aerror(f"Validation error for item: {e}")
                        # Include invalid items with error info
                        validated_objects.append({"data": item, "validation_error": str(e)})
                return validated_objects

            # Single object
            try:
                validated_obj = output_model.model_validate(json_data)
                return [validated_obj.model_dump()]  # Return as list for consistency
            except ValidationError as e:
                await logger.aerror(f"Validation error: {e}")
                return [{"data": json_data, "validation_error": str(e)}]

        except (TypeError, ValueError) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Error building structured output: {e}")
            # Fallback to parsed JSON without validation
            return json_data

    async def json_response(self) -> Data:
        """Convert agent response to structured JSON Data output with schema validation."""
        # Always use structured chat agent for JSON response mode for better JSON formatting
        try:
            system_components = []

            # 1. Agent Instructions (system_prompt)
            agent_instructions = getattr(self, "system_prompt", "") or ""
            if agent_instructions:
                system_components.append(f"{agent_instructions}")

            # 2. Format Instructions
            format_instructions = getattr(self, "format_instructions", "") or ""
            if format_instructions:
                system_components.append(f"Format instructions: {format_instructions}")

            # 3. Schema Information from BaseModel
            if hasattr(self, "output_schema") and self.output_schema and len(self.output_schema) > 0:
                try:
                    processed_schema = self._preprocess_schema(self.output_schema)
                    output_model = build_model_from_schema(processed_schema)
                    schema_dict = output_model.model_json_schema()
                    schema_info = (
                        "You are given some text that may include format instructions, "
                        "explanations, or other content alongside a JSON schema.\n\n"
                        "Your task:\n"
                        "- Extract only the JSON schema.\n"
                        "- Return it as valid JSON.\n"
                        "- Do not include format instructions, explanations, or extra text.\n\n"
                        "Input:\n"
                        f"{json.dumps(schema_dict, indent=2)}\n\n"
                        "Output (only JSON schema):"
                    )
                    system_components.append(schema_info)
                except (ValidationError, ValueError, TypeError, KeyError) as e:
                    await logger.aerror(f"Could not build schema for prompt: {e}", exc_info=True)

            # Combine all components
            combined_instructions = "\n\n".join(system_components) if system_components else ""
            llm_model, self.chat_history, self.tools = await self.get_agent_requirements()
            self.set(
                llm=llm_model,
                tools=self.tools or [],
                chat_history=self.chat_history,
                input_value=self.input_value,
                system_prompt=combined_instructions,
            )

            # Create and run structured chat agent
            try:
                structured_agent = self.create_agent_runnable()
            except (NotImplementedError, ValueError, TypeError) as e:
                await logger.aerror(f"Error with structured chat agent: {e}")
                raise
            try:
                result = await self.run_agent(structured_agent)
            except (
                ExceptionWithMessageError,
                ValueError,
                TypeError,
                RuntimeError,
            ) as e:
                await logger.aerror(f"Error with structured agent result: {e}")
                raise
            # Extract content from structured agent result
            if hasattr(result, "content"):
                content = result.content
            elif hasattr(result, "text"):
                content = result.text
            else:
                content = str(result)

        except (
            ExceptionWithMessageError,
            ValueError,
            TypeError,
            NotImplementedError,
            AttributeError,
        ) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Error with structured chat agent: {e}")
            # Fallback to regular agent
            content_str = "No content returned from agent"
            return Data(data={"content": content_str, "error": str(e)})

        # Process with structured output validation
        try:
            structured_output = await self.build_structured_output_base(content)

            # Handle different output formats
            if isinstance(structured_output, list) and structured_output:
                if len(structured_output) == 1:
                    return Data(data=structured_output[0])
                return Data(data={"results": structured_output})
            if isinstance(structured_output, dict):
                return Data(data=structured_output)
            return Data(data={"content": content})

        except (ValueError, TypeError) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Error in structured output processing: {e}")
            return Data(data={"content": content, "error": str(e)})

    async def get_memory_data(self):
        # TODO: This is a temporary fix to avoid message duplication. We should develop a function for this.
        messages = (
            await MemoryComponent(**self.get_base_args())
            .set(
                session_id=self.graph.session_id,
                order="Ascending",
                n_messages=self.n_messages,
            )
            .retrieve_messages()
        )
        return [
            message for message in messages if getattr(message, "id", None) != getattr(self.input_value, "id", None)
        ]

    async def get_llm(self):
        if not isinstance(self.agent_llm, str):
            return self.agent_llm, None

        try:
            provider_info = MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT.get(self.agent_llm)
            if not provider_info:
                msg = f"Invalid model provider: {self.agent_llm}"
                raise ValueError(msg)

            component_class = provider_info.get("component_class")
            display_name = component_class.display_name
            inputs = provider_info.get("inputs")
            prefix = provider_info.get("prefix", "")

            return self._build_llm_model(component_class, inputs, prefix), display_name

        except (AttributeError, ValueError, TypeError, RuntimeError) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Error building {self.agent_llm} language model: {e!s}")
            msg = f"Failed to initialize language model: {e!s}"
            raise ValueError(msg) from e

    def _build_llm_model(self, component, inputs, prefix=""):
        model_kwargs = {}
        for input_ in inputs:
            if hasattr(self, f"{prefix}{input_.name}"):
                model_kwargs[input_.name] = getattr(self, f"{prefix}{input_.name}")
        return component.set(**model_kwargs).build_model()

    def set_component_params(self, component):
        provider_info = MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT.get(self.agent_llm)
        if provider_info:
            inputs = provider_info.get("inputs")
            prefix = provider_info.get("prefix")
            # Filter out json_mode and only use attributes that exist on this component
            model_kwargs = {}
            for input_ in inputs:
                if hasattr(self, f"{prefix}{input_.name}"):
                    model_kwargs[input_.name] = getattr(self, f"{prefix}{input_.name}")

            return component.set(**model_kwargs)
        return component

    def delete_fields(self, build_config: dotdict, fields: dict | list[str]) -> None:
        """Delete specified fields from build_config."""
        for field in fields:
            build_config.pop(field, None)

    def update_input_types(self, build_config: dotdict) -> dotdict:
        """Update input types for all fields in build_config."""
        for key, value in build_config.items():
            if isinstance(value, dict):
                if value.get("input_types") is None:
                    build_config[key]["input_types"] = []
            elif hasattr(value, "input_types") and value.input_types is None:
                value.input_types = []
        return build_config

    async def update_build_config(
        self, build_config: dotdict, field_value: str, field_name: str | None = None
    ) -> dotdict:
        # Iterate over all providers in the MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT
        # Existing logic for updating build_config
        if field_name in ("agent_llm",):
            build_config["agent_llm"]["value"] = field_value
            provider_info = MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT.get(field_value)
            if provider_info:
                component_class = provider_info.get("component_class")
                if component_class and hasattr(component_class, "update_build_config"):
                    # Call the component class's update_build_config method
                    build_config = await update_component_build_config(
                        component_class, build_config, field_value, "model_name"
                    )

            provider_configs: dict[str, tuple[dict, list[dict]]] = {
                provider: (
                    MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT[provider]["fields"],
                    [
                        MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT[other_provider]["fields"]
                        for other_provider in MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT
                        if other_provider != provider
                    ],
                )
                for provider in MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT
            }
            if field_value in provider_configs:
                fields_to_add, fields_to_delete = provider_configs[field_value]

                # Delete fields from other providers
                for fields in fields_to_delete:
                    self.delete_fields(build_config, fields)

                # Add provider-specific fields
                if field_value == "OpenAI" and not any(field in build_config for field in fields_to_add):
                    build_config.update(fields_to_add)
                else:
                    build_config.update(fields_to_add)
                # Reset input types for agent_llm
                build_config["agent_llm"]["input_types"] = []
                build_config["agent_llm"]["display_name"] = "Model Provider"
            elif field_value == "connect_other_models":
                # Delete all provider fields
                self.delete_fields(build_config, ALL_PROVIDER_FIELDS)
                # # Update with custom component
                custom_component = DropdownInput(
                    name="agent_llm",
                    display_name="Language Model",
                    info="The provider of the language model that the agent will use to generate responses.",
                    options=[*MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST],
                    real_time_refresh=True,
                    refresh_button=False,
                    input_types=["LanguageModel"],
                    placeholder="Awaiting model input.",
                    options_metadata=[MODELS_METADATA[key] for key in MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST],
                    external_options={
                        "fields": {
                            "data": {
                                "node": {
                                    "name": "connect_other_models",
                                    "display_name": "Connect other models",
                                    "icon": "CornerDownLeft",
                                },
                            }
                        },
                    },
                )
                build_config.update({"agent_llm": custom_component.to_dict()})
            # Update input types for all fields
            build_config = self.update_input_types(build_config)

            # Validate required keys
            default_keys = [
                "code",
                "_type",
                "agent_llm",
                "tools",
                "input_value",
                "add_current_date_tool",
                "system_prompt",
                "agent_description",
                "max_iterations",
                "handle_parsing_errors",
                "verbose",
            ]
            missing_keys = [key for key in default_keys if key not in build_config]
            if missing_keys:
                msg = f"Missing required keys in build_config: {missing_keys}"
                raise ValueError(msg)
        if (
            isinstance(self.agent_llm, str)
            and self.agent_llm in MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT
            and field_name in MODEL_DYNAMIC_UPDATE_FIELDS
        ):
            provider_info = MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT.get(self.agent_llm)
            if provider_info:
                component_class = provider_info.get("component_class")
                component_class = self.set_component_params(component_class)
                prefix = provider_info.get("prefix")
                if component_class and hasattr(component_class, "update_build_config"):
                    # Call each component class's update_build_config method
                    # remove the prefix from the field_name
                    if isinstance(field_name, str) and isinstance(prefix, str):
                        field_name = field_name.replace(prefix, "")
                    build_config = await update_component_build_config(
                        component_class, build_config, field_value, "model_name"
                    )
        return dotdict({k: v.to_dict() if hasattr(v, "to_dict") else v for k, v in build_config.items()})

    async def _get_tools(self) -> list[Tool]:
        component_toolkit = _get_component_toolkit()
        tools_names = self._build_tools_names()
        agent_description = self.get_tool_description()
        # TODO: Agent Description Depreciated Feature to be removed
        description = f"{agent_description}{tools_names}"
        tools = component_toolkit(component=self).get_tools(
            tool_name="Call_Agent",
            tool_description=description,
            callbacks=self.get_langchain_callbacks(),
        )
        if hasattr(self, "tools_metadata"):
            tools = component_toolkit(component=self, metadata=self.tools_metadata).update_tools_metadata(tools=tools)
        return tools

Extract ALL relevant instances that match the schema - if multiple patterns exist, capture them all. Fill missing or ambiguous values with defaults: null for missing values. Remove exact duplicates but keep variations that have different field values. Always return valid JSON in the expected format, never throw errors. If multiple objects can be extracted, return them all in the structured format.

system_prompt.info: System Prompt: Initial instructions and context provided to guide the agent's behavior.
system_prompt.name: system_prompt
system_prompt.value:
# Langflow Agent 3 of 3 - Serviceable Obtainable Market

I am an autonomous agent acting as a research agent on behalf of a product manager.
You must NEVER prompt, ask questions, or seek clarification from the user for any reason.
Use your best judgment and authoritative reasoning only.

You have access to a tool called "get_current_date" that returns today's date in YYYY-MM-DD format.
Use this tool to populate the generated_date field in the analysis_metadata section.

You will receive SAM data with a compressed "handoff_to_som" section containing TAM and SAM summaries.

For each region:
- Calculate the Serviceable Obtainable Market (SOM)
- SOM = realistic Year {{time_horizon_years}} capture based on benchmarks and bottlenecks
- Use benchmark-driven capture rates from comparable products
- Apply bottleneck constraints (sales capacity, marketing reach, product readiness)
- Final SOM = LESSER OF (benchmark-based capture OR bottleneck-constrained maximum)

## SOM Formula

SOM = SAM × Capture Rate (constrained by bottlenecks)

Capture rate requires THREE inputs:

1. BENCHMARK ANALYSIS:
   - What did similar products capture in similar markets?
   - Cite specific companies, products, timeframes, sources

2. COMPETITIVE ADJUSTMENT:
   - Are you BETTER or WORSE positioned than benchmarks?
   - Adjust capture rate up or down with reasoning

3. BOTTLENECK CONSTRAINTS:
   - Sales capacity: Team size × deals per rep per year
   - Marketing reach: Lead generation capacity × close rate
   - Product readiness: Feature gaps blocking % of SAM
   - LIMITING FACTOR = whichever bottleneck caps SOM most

## Source Requirements

MUST provide for capture rates and bottlenecks:
- Specific benchmark examples with URLs
- Company names, product names, market contexts
- Sales capacity calculations (show math)
- Data quality: Primary / Secondary / Interpolated

Primary sources: Company case studies, investor reports, industry benchmarks
Secondary sources: Analyst reports, news articles, market research

## SOM Calculation Process

CRITICAL: Calculate each region INDEPENDENTLY. Do NOT carry benchmarks, adjustments, or bottlenecks from one region to another. Each region gets its own analysis.

For each region:
1. Start with THIS REGION's SAM (from handoff_to_som)
2. Identify 2-3 comparable product benchmarks (can be same benchmarks across regions if truly comparable)
3. Calculate base capture rate from benchmarks FOR THIS REGION
4. Apply competitive adjustments FOR THIS REGION (+/- based on this region's advantages/disadvantages)
5. Calculate bottleneck constraints FOR THIS REGION (sales, marketing, product capacity)
6. Final SOM = LESSER OF (THIS REGION's benchmark capture OR THIS REGION's bottleneck limit)

Example calculation flow for 3 regions:
- Region 1: SAM=3,557 → Benchmark 5% → Benchmark-based=178 → Bottleneck=200 → SOM=178 (benchmark constrains)
- Region 2: SAM=5,040 → Benchmark 5% → Benchmark-based=252 → Bottleneck=200 → SOM=200 (bottleneck constrains)
- Region 3: SAM=3,360 → Benchmark 5% → Benchmark-based=168 → Bottleneck=200 → SOM=168 (benchmark constrains)
- TOTAL SOM: 178 + 200 + 168 = 546 (NOT 178 applied to all regions)

## Output Format

Output one JSON document only (no commentary, no explanations).
Your ENTIRE response must be a single JSON object starting with { and ending with }
NO text before the JSON, NO text after the JSON, JUST the JSON object.

DO NOT use markdown code blocks, DO NOT use ``` or ~~~, just raw JSON.

    "product": "{{product}}",
    "specialty": "{{specialty}}",
    "segment": "{{segment}}",
    "currency": "{{currency}}",

      "sources": ["https://url1", "https://url2"],
      "reasoning": "1-2 sentences on why this SOM is realistic",
      "assumptions": ["assumption 1", "assumption 2"],
      "confidence": "High / Medium / Low",
      "confidence_rationale": "1 sentence"
    }
  ],
  "summary": {
    "total_tam": {
      "entities": 0,  // MUST equal: SUM of starting_points.tam_entities from ALL regions
      "value": 0  // MUST equal: SUM of starting_points.tam_value from ALL regions
    },
    "total_sam": {
      "entities": 0,  // MUST equal: SUM of starting_points.sam_entities from ALL regions
      "value": 0  // MUST equal: SUM of starting_points.sam_value from ALL regions
    },
    "total_som": {
      "entities": 0,  // MUST equal: SUM of final_som.entities from ALL regions
      "value": 0  // MUST equal: SUM of final_som.value from ALL regions
    },
    "currency": "{{currency}}"
  },
  // VERIFICATION: Before outputting summary, verify your math:
  // 1. Add up all regions' starting_points.tam_entities → put in total_tam.entities
  // 2. Add up all regions' starting_points.tam_value → put in total_tam.value
  // 3. Add up all regions' starting_points.sam_entities → put in total_sam.entities
  // 4. Add up all regions' starting_points.sam_value → put in total_sam.value
  // 5. Add up all regions' final_som.entities → put in total_som.entities
  // 6. Add up all regions' final_som.value → put in total_som.value
  // Example: If 3 regions have final_som.entities of 3, 3, and 3, then total_som.entities = 9
  // DO NOT subtract, average, or apply any other operation. ONLY addition.
  "funnel_metrics": {
    "sam_as_pct_of_tam": "X%",
    "som_as_pct_of_sam": "X%",
    "som_as_pct_of_tam": "X%"
  },
  "recommendations": {
    "year_1_target_entities": 0,
    "year_1_target_revenue": 0,
    "confidence": "High / Medium / Low",
    "primary_risks": ["risk 1", "risk 2", "risk 3"],
    "competitive_positioning": "1-2 sentences on how to win",
    "focus_regions": ["Region 1", "Region 2"],
    "focus_regions_rationale": "1 sentence on prioritization logic"
  }
}

## Constraints

- NEVER prompt or ask questions
- NEVER output commentary outside JSON
- ALWAYS cite specific benchmark examples with URLs
- ALWAYS calculate bottleneck constraints (show math)
- ALWAYS use LESSER OF benchmark vs bottleneck for final SOM
- ALWAYS calculate each region independently (do NOT apply one region's capture rate to another)
- ALWAYS sum regional starting_points and final_som values in summary using simple addition
- NEVER subtract, average, weight, or apply any operation other than addition to summary totals
- Keep reasoning to 1-2 sentences per field
- Valid JSON only (no markdown code blocks, no ```, no ~~~)
- Your entire response must be JSON starting with { and ending with }
- Dynamic regions - match whatever regions came from SAM handoff
- Call get_current_date tool for generated_date field
- SOM capture rates should typically be 1-5% of SAM for most B2B products
- If data unavailable, make reasonable assumption and list under "assumptions"

node.description:
## **Total Addressable Market (TAM) Agent**
### *The complete market universe, quantified*
   - **Purpose:** Identifies and calculates the **total addressable market** across all specified regions.
   - **Core Functions:**
     - Researches **practice counts by specialty and segment** using authoritative sources.
     - Calculates **theoretical maximum revenue** at the specified price point.
     - Documents **assumptions and data sources** for transparency.
     - Generates **compressed handoff data** for the next agent.
   - **Tools Used:**
     - **State medical boards and health department databases** for practice counts.
     - **Market research and industry reports** for validation.
     - **Economic modeling** to project total market value.## **User Story Agent**
   - **Purpose:** Converts **each epic into three detailed user stories** for execution.
   - **Core Functions:**
     - Retains **solution opportunity context** for clarity.
     - Uses a **role-action-outcome format** for structure.
     - Adds **success metrics** for tracking impact.
   - **Tools Used:**
     - **Agile story formatting** for alignment with execution.
     - **Success tracking frameworks** for measurable outcomes.

## **Serviceable Addressable Market (SAM) Agent**
### *From universe to reality - what we can actually reach*
   - **Purpose:** Filters TAM down to the **realistically reachable portion** in Year 1.
   - **Core Functions:**
     - Applies **go-to-market constraints** (sales capacity, geography, integration readiness).
     - Identifies **early adopter segments** and technology-ready practices.
     - Calculates **reachability percentages** for each region.
     - Passes **compressed TAM+SAM summary** to final stage.
   - **Tools Used:**
     - **Adoption readiness frameworks** to assess EHR integration feasibility.
     - **Sales territory modeling** for geographic reach analysis.
     - **Market segmentation criteria** to filter qualified prospects.

## **Serviceable Obtainable Market (SOM) Agent**
### *Real capture rates meet real competition*
   - **Purpose:** Calculates **realistic Year 1 market capture** and assembles the complete analysis.
   - **Core Functions:**
     - Estimates **obtainable market share** using competitive benchmarks.
     - Reconstructs **full TAM/SAM/SOM structure** from compressed handoffs.
     - Generates **funnel metrics and conversion rates** across all stages.
     - Produces **strategic recommendations** with targets, risks, and positioning.
   - **Tools Used:**
     - **Competitive analysis frameworks** for market share estimation.
     - **Digital health adoption benchmarks** for realistic capture rates.
     - **Financial modeling** to calculate target revenue and confidence levels.

## **Context Input**
### *Configure your market analysis - edit this JSON*
   - **Purpose:** Sets **all parameters** for the TAM/SAM/SOM pipeline.
   - **Instructions for Users:**
     - **Edit the JSON object** with your product details.
     - Update **regions, segment, specialty** to match your market.
     - Set **price_assumption** to your annual contract value.
     - Add **competitor info and barriers** in the notes field.
   - **Critical Fields:**
     - `product` - What you're selling
     - `regions` - Where you're selling it
     - `segment` - Who you're selling to
     - `specialty` - Practice type/vertical
     - `price_assumption` - Revenue per customer
     - `notes` - Context for better AI analysis
   - **Format:** Valid JSON with double quotes, no trailing commas.

## **The TAM-SAM-SOM-o-Matic 3000™**
### *Autonomous market sizing from research to executive brief*
   - **Purpose:** Generates **complete TAM/SAM/SOM analysis** with regional breakdowns, funnel metrics, and executive intelligence brief—fully automated from one JSON input.
   - **The Architecture:**
     - **Agent 1 (TAM):** Researches total addressable market using authoritative sources
     - **Agent 2 (SAM):** Filters to realistically reachable practices based on go-to-market constraints
     - **Agent 3 (SOM):** Calculates Year 1 capture, outputs complete JSON analysis
     - **Agent 4 (Brief):** Transforms data into executive weekly intelligence report using Claude Sonnet 3.7
     - **Date Tool:** Python function for dynamic timestamps
   - **What You Get:**
     - **JSON archive** with complete TAM/SAM/SOM by region, sourced and documented
     - **Executive brief** in chat: scannable tables, risk assessment, strategic recommendations
     - **Funnel metrics** showing conversion rates at each stage
     - **Year 1 targets** with revenue projections and confidence levels
   - **Key Features:**
     - **Compressed handoffs** prevent token bloat between agents
     - **Multi-model strategy:** GPT-4 for research, Claude for synthesis
     - **Dual output:** Technical JSON + human narrative
     - **Tool integration** for dynamic date injection
     - **Recurring-ready** for weekly market tracking
   - **Teaching Applications:** Multi-agent orchestration, token management, tool integration, structured output engineering, multi-model strategy, data-to-narrative transformation, autonomous workflow design, enterprise reporting patterns.
   - **Perfect For:** B2B healthcare products, SaaS platforms, digital health solutions. Designed for AI product management courses demonstrating autonomous agent workflows.

node.description: Display a chat message in the Playground.

code.name: code
code.value:
from collections.abc import Generator
from typing import Any

import orjson
from fastapi.encoders import jsonable_encoder

from langflow.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from langflow.helpers.data import safe_convert
from langflow.inputs.inputs import BoolInput, DropdownInput, HandleInput, MessageTextInput
from langflow.schema.data import Data
from langflow.schema.dataframe import DataFrame
from langflow.schema.message import Message
from langflow.schema.properties import Source
from langflow.template.field.base import Output
from langflow.utils.constants import (
    MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
    MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
    MESSAGE_SENDER_USER,
)


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    documentation: str = "https://docs.langflow.org/components-io#chat-output"
    icon = "MessagesSquare"
    name = "ChatOutput"
    minimized = True

    inputs = [
        HandleInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Inputs",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
            input_types=["Data", "DataFrame", "Message"],
            required=True,
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(
            display_name="Output Message",
            name="message",
            method="message_response",
        ),
    ]

    def _build_source(self, id_: str | None, display_name: str | None, source: str | None) -> Source:
        source_dict = {}
        if id_:
            source_dict["id"] = id_
        if display_name:
            source_dict["display_name"] = display_name
        if source:
            # Handle case where source is a ChatOpenAI object
            if hasattr(source, "model_name"):
                source_dict["source"] = source.model_name
            elif hasattr(source, "model"):
                source_dict["source"] = str(source.model)
            else:
                source_dict["source"] = str(source)
        return Source(**source_dict)

    async def message_response(self) -> Message:
        # First convert the input to string if needed
        text = self.convert_to_string()

        # Get source properties
        source, _icon, display_name, source_id = self.get_properties_from_source_component()

        # Create or use existing Message object
        if isinstance(self.input_value, Message):
            message = self.input_value
            # Update message properties
            message.text = text
        else:
            message = Message(text=text)

        # Set message properties
        message.sender = self.sender
        message.sender_name = self.sender_name
        message.session_id = self.session_id
        message.flow_id = self.graph.flow_id if hasattr(self, "graph") else None
        message.properties.source = self._build_source(source_id, display_name, source)

        # Store message if needed
        if self.session_id and self.should_store_message:
            stored_message = await self.send_message(message)
            self.message.value = stored_message
            message = stored_message

        self.status = message
        return message

    def _serialize_data(self, data: Data) -> str:
        """Serialize Data object to JSON string."""
        # Convert data.data to JSON-serializable format
        serializable_data = jsonable_encoder(data.data)
        # Serialize with orjson, enabling pretty printing with indentation
        json_bytes = orjson.dumps(serializable_data, option=orjson.OPT_INDENT_2)
        # Convert bytes to string and wrap in Markdown code blocks
        return "```json\n" + json_bytes.decode("utf-8") + "\n```"

    def _validate_input(self) -> None:
        """Validate the input data and raise ValueError if invalid."""
        if self.input_value is None:
            msg = "Input data cannot be None"
            raise ValueError(msg)
        if isinstance(self.input_value, list) and not all(
            isinstance(item, Message | Data | DataFrame | str) for item in self.input_value
        ):
            invalid_types = [
                type(item).__name__
                for item in self.input_value
                if not isinstance(item, Message | Data | DataFrame | str)
            ]
            msg = f"Expected Data or DataFrame or Message or str, got {invalid_types}"
            raise TypeError(msg)
        if not isinstance(
            self.input_value,
            Message | Data | DataFrame | str | list | Generator | type(None),
        ):
            type_name = type(self.input_value).__name__
            msg = f"Expected Data or DataFrame or Message or str, Generator or None, got {type_name}"
            raise TypeError(msg)

    def convert_to_string(self) -> str | Generator[Any, None, None]:
        """Convert input data to string with proper error handling."""
        self._validate_input()
        if isinstance(self.input_value, list):
            clean_data: bool = getattr(self, "clean_data", False)
            return "\n".join([safe_convert(item, clean_data=clean_data) for item in self.input_value])
        if isinstance(self.input_value, Generator):
            return self.input_value
        return safe_convert(self.input_value)

data_template.info: Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.

code.name: code
code.value:
import json
import re

from langchain_core.tools import StructuredTool
from pydantic import ValidationError

from langflow.base.agents.agent import LCToolsAgentComponent
from langflow.base.agents.events import ExceptionWithMessageError
from langflow.base.models.model_input_constants import (
    ALL_PROVIDER_FIELDS,
    MODEL_DYNAMIC_UPDATE_FIELDS,
    MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT,
    MODELS_METADATA,
)
from langflow.base.models.model_utils import get_model_name
from langflow.components.helpers.current_date import CurrentDateComponent
from langflow.components.helpers.memory import MemoryComponent
from langflow.components.langchain_utilities.tool_calling import (
    ToolCallingAgentComponent,
)
from langflow.custom.custom_component.component import _get_component_toolkit
from langflow.custom.utils import update_component_build_config
from langflow.field_typing import Tool
from langflow.helpers.base_model import build_model_from_schema
from langflow.io import (
    BoolInput,
    DropdownInput,
    IntInput,
    MultilineInput,
    Output,
    TableInput,
)
from langflow.logging import logger
from langflow.schema.data import Data
from langflow.schema.dotdict import dotdict
from langflow.schema.message import Message
from langflow.schema.table import EditMode


def set_advanced_true(component_input):
    component_input.advanced = True
    return component_input


MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST = ["Anthropic", "Google Generative AI", "OpenAI"]


class AgentComponent(ToolCallingAgentComponent):
    display_name: str = "Agent"
    description: str = "Define the agent's instructions, then enter a task to complete using tools."
    documentation: str = "https://docs.langflow.org/agents"
    icon = "bot"
    beta = False
    name = "Agent"

    memory_inputs = [set_advanced_true(component_input) for component_input in MemoryComponent().inputs]

    # Filter out json_mode from OpenAI inputs since we handle structured output differently
    openai_inputs_filtered = [
        input_field
        for input_field in MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT["OpenAI"]["inputs"]
        if not (hasattr(input_field, "name") and input_field.name == "json_mode")
    ]

    inputs = [
        DropdownInput(
            name="agent_llm",
            display_name="Model Provider",
            info="The provider of the language model that the agent will use to generate responses.",
            options=[*MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST],
            value="OpenAI",
            real_time_refresh=True,
            refresh_button=False,
            input_types=[],
            options_metadata=[MODELS_METADATA[key] for key in MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST],
            external_options={
                "fields": {
                    "data": {
                        "node": {
                            "name": "connect_other_models",
                            "display_name": "Connect other models",
                            "icon": "CornerDownLeft",
                        }
                    }
                },
            },
        ),
        *openai_inputs_filtered,
        MultilineInput(
            name="system_prompt",
            display_name="Agent Instructions",
            info="System Prompt: Initial instructions and context provided to guide the agent's behavior.",
            value="You are a helpful assistant that can use tools to answer questions and perform tasks.",
            advanced=False,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="n_messages",
            display_name="Number of Chat History Messages",
            value=100,
            info="Number of chat history messages to retrieve.",
            advanced=True,
            show=True,
        ),
        MultilineInput(
            name="format_instructions",
            display_name="Output Format Instructions",
            info="Generic Template for structured output formatting. Valid only with Structured response.",
            value=(
                "You are an AI that extracts structured JSON objects from unstructured text. "
                "Use a predefined schema with expected types (str, int, float, bool, dict). "
                "Extract ALL relevant instances that match the schema - if multiple patterns exist, capture them all. "
                "Fill missing or ambiguous values with defaults: null for missing values. "
                "Remove exact duplicates but keep variations that have different field values. "
                "Always return valid JSON in the expected format, never throw errors. "
                "If multiple objects can be extracted, return them all in the structured format."
            ),
            advanced=True,
        ),
        TableInput(
            name="output_schema",
            display_name="Output Schema",
            info=(
                "Schema Validation: Define the structure and data types for structured output. "
                "No validation if no output schema."
            ),
            advanced=True,
            required=False,
            value=[],
            table_schema=[
                {
                    "name": "name",
                    "display_name": "Name",
                    "type": "str",
                    "description": "Specify the name of the output field.",
                    "default": "field",
                    "edit_mode": EditMode.INLINE,
                },
                {
                    "name": "description",
                    "display_name": "Description",
                    "type": "str",
                    "description": "Describe the purpose of the output field.",
                    "default": "description of field",
                    "edit_mode": EditMode.POPOVER,
                },
                {
                    "name": "type",
                    "display_name": "Type",
                    "type": "str",
                    "edit_mode": EditMode.INLINE,
                    "description": ("Indicate the data type of the output field (e.g., str, int, float, bool, dict)."),
                    "options": ["str", "int", "float", "bool", "dict"],
                    "default": "str",
                },
                {
                    "name": "multiple",
                    "display_name": "As List",
                    "type": "boolean",
                    "description": "Set to True if this output field should be a list of the specified type.",
                    "default": "False",
                    "edit_mode": EditMode.INLINE,
                },
            ],
        ),
        *LCToolsAgentComponent._base_inputs,
        # removed memory inputs from agent component
        # *memory_inputs,
        BoolInput(
            name="add_current_date_tool",
            display_name="Current Date",
            advanced=True,
            info="If true, will add a tool to the agent that returns the current date.",
            value=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(name="response", display_name="Response", method="message_response"),
    ]

    async def get_agent_requirements(self):
        """Get the agent requirements for the agent."""
        llm_model, display_name = await self.get_llm()
        if llm_model is None:
            msg = "No language model selected. Please choose a model to proceed."
            raise ValueError(msg)
        self.model_name = get_model_name(llm_model, display_name=display_name)

        # Get memory data
        self.chat_history = await self.get_memory_data()
        if isinstance(self.chat_history, Message):
            self.chat_history = [self.chat_history]

        # Add current date tool if enabled
        if self.add_current_date_tool:
            if not isinstance(self.tools, list):  # type: ignore[has-type]
                self.tools = []
            current_date_tool = (await CurrentDateComponent(**self.get_base_args()).to_toolkit()).pop(0)
            if not isinstance(current_date_tool, StructuredTool):
                msg = "CurrentDateComponent must be converted to a StructuredTool"
                raise TypeError(msg)
            self.tools.append(current_date_tool)
        return llm_model, self.chat_history, self.tools

    async def message_response(self) -> Message:
        try:
            llm_model, self.chat_history, self.tools = await self.get_agent_requirements()
            # Set up and run agent
            self.set(
                llm=llm_model,
                tools=self.tools or [],
                chat_history=self.chat_history,
                input_value=self.input_value,
                system_prompt=self.system_prompt,
            )
            agent = self.create_agent_runnable()
            result = await self.run_agent(agent)

            # Store result for potential JSON output
            self._agent_result = result

        except (ValueError, TypeError, KeyError) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"{type(e).__name__}: {e!s}")
            raise
        except ExceptionWithMessageError as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"ExceptionWithMessageError occurred: {e}")
            raise
        # Avoid catching blind Exception; let truly unexpected exceptions propagate
        except Exception as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Unexpected error: {e!s}")
            raise
        else:
            return result

    def _preprocess_schema(self, schema):
        """Preprocess schema to ensure correct data types for build_model_from_schema."""
        processed_schema = []
        for field in schema:
            processed_field = {
                "name": str(field.get("name", "field")),
                "type": str(field.get("type", "str")),
                "description": str(field.get("description", "")),
                "multiple": field.get("multiple", False),
            }
            # Ensure multiple is handled correctly
            if isinstance(processed_field["multiple"], str):
                processed_field["multiple"] = processed_field["multiple"].lower() in [
                    "true",
                    "1",
                    "t",
                    "y",
                    "yes",
                ]
            processed_schema.append(processed_field)
        return processed_schema

    async def build_structured_output_base(self, content: str):
        """Build structured output with optional BaseModel validation."""
        json_pattern = r"\{.*\}"
        schema_error_msg = "Try setting an output schema"

        # Try to parse content as JSON first
        json_data = None
        try:
            json_data = json.loads(content)
        except json.JSONDecodeError:
            json_match = re.search(json_pattern, content, re.DOTALL)
            if json_match:
                try:
                    json_data = json.loads(json_match.group())
                except json.JSONDecodeError:
                    return {"content": content, "error": schema_error_msg}
            else:
                return {"content": content, "error": schema_error_msg}

        # If no output schema provided, return parsed JSON without validation
        if not hasattr(self, "output_schema") or not self.output_schema or len(self.output_schema) == 0:
            return json_data

        # Use BaseModel validation with schema
        try:
            processed_schema = self._preprocess_schema(self.output_schema)
            output_model = build_model_from_schema(processed_schema)

            # Validate against the schema
            if isinstance(json_data, list):
                # Multiple objects
                validated_objects = []
                for item in json_data:
                    try:
                        validated_obj = output_model.model_validate(item)
                        validated_objects.append(validated_obj.model_dump())
                    except ValidationError as e:
                        await logger.aerror(f"Validation error for item: {e}")
                        # Include invalid items with error info
                        validated_objects.append({"data": item, "validation_error": str(e)})
                return validated_objects

            # Single object
            try:
                validated_obj = output_model.model_validate(json_data)
                return [validated_obj.model_dump()]  # Return as list for consistency
            except ValidationError as e:
                await logger.aerror(f"Validation error: {e}")
                return [{"data": json_data, "validation_error": str(e)}]

        except (TypeError, ValueError) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Error building structured output: {e}")
            # Fallback to parsed JSON without validation
            return json_data

    async def json_response(self) -> Data:
        """Convert agent response to structured JSON Data output with schema validation."""
        # Always use structured chat agent for JSON response mode for better JSON formatting
        try:
            system_components = []

            # 1. Agent Instructions (system_prompt)
            agent_instructions = getattr(self, "system_prompt", "") or ""
            if agent_instructions:
                system_components.append(f"{agent_instructions}")

            # 2. Format Instructions
            format_instructions = getattr(self, "format_instructions", "") or ""
            if format_instructions:
                system_components.append(f"Format instructions: {format_instructions}")

            # 3. Schema Information from BaseModel
            if hasattr(self, "output_schema") and self.output_schema and len(self.output_schema) > 0:
                try:
                    processed_schema = self._preprocess_schema(self.output_schema)
                    output_model = build_model_from_schema(processed_schema)
                    schema_dict = output_model.model_json_schema()
                    schema_info = (
                        "You are given some text that may include format instructions, "
                        "explanations, or other content alongside a JSON schema.\n\n"
                        "Your task:\n"
                        "- Extract only the JSON schema.\n"
                        "- Return it as valid JSON.\n"
                        "- Do not include format instructions, explanations, or extra text.\n\n"
                        "Input:\n"
                        f"{json.dumps(schema_dict, indent=2)}\n\n"
                        "Output (only JSON schema):"
                    )
                    system_components.append(schema_info)
                except (ValidationError, ValueError, TypeError, KeyError) as e:
                    await logger.aerror(f"Could not build schema for prompt: {e}", exc_info=True)

            # Combine all components
            combined_instructions = "\n\n".join(system_components) if system_components else ""
            llm_model, self.chat_history, self.tools = await self.get_agent_requirements()
            self.set(
                llm=llm_model,
                tools=self.tools or [],
                chat_history=self.chat_history,
                input_value=self.input_value,
                system_prompt=combined_instructions,
            )

            # Create and run structured chat agent
            try:
                structured_agent = self.create_agent_runnable()
            except (NotImplementedError, ValueError, TypeError) as e:
                await logger.aerror(f"Error with structured chat agent: {e}")
                raise
            try:
                result = await self.run_agent(structured_agent)
            except (
                ExceptionWithMessageError,
                ValueError,
                TypeError,
                RuntimeError,
            ) as e:
                await logger.aerror(f"Error with structured agent result: {e}")
                raise
            # Extract content from structured agent result
            if hasattr(result, "content"):
                content = result.content
            elif hasattr(result, "text"):
                content = result.text
            else:
                content = str(result)

        except (
            ExceptionWithMessageError,
            ValueError,
            TypeError,
            NotImplementedError,
            AttributeError,
        ) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Error with structured chat agent: {e}")
            # Fallback to regular agent
            content_str = "No content returned from agent"
            return Data(data={"content": content_str, "error": str(e)})

        # Process with structured output validation
        try:
            structured_output = await self.build_structured_output_base(content)

            # Handle different output formats
            if isinstance(structured_output, list) and structured_output:
                if len(structured_output) == 1:
                    return Data(data=structured_output[0])
                return Data(data={"results": structured_output})
            if isinstance(structured_output, dict):
                return Data(data=structured_output)
            return Data(data={"content": content})

        except (ValueError, TypeError) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Error in structured output processing: {e}")
            return Data(data={"content": content, "error": str(e)})

    async def get_memory_data(self):
        # TODO: This is a temporary fix to avoid message duplication. We should develop a function for this.
        messages = (
            await MemoryComponent(**self.get_base_args())
            .set(
                session_id=self.graph.session_id,
                order="Ascending",
                n_messages=self.n_messages,
            )
            .retrieve_messages()
        )
        return [
            message for message in messages if getattr(message, "id", None) != getattr(self.input_value, "id", None)
        ]

    async def get_llm(self):
        if not isinstance(self.agent_llm, str):
            return self.agent_llm, None

        try:
            provider_info = MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT.get(self.agent_llm)
            if not provider_info:
                msg = f"Invalid model provider: {self.agent_llm}"
                raise ValueError(msg)

            component_class = provider_info.get("component_class")
            display_name = component_class.display_name
            inputs = provider_info.get("inputs")
            prefix = provider_info.get("prefix", "")

            return self._build_llm_model(component_class, inputs, prefix), display_name

        except (AttributeError, ValueError, TypeError, RuntimeError) as e:
            await logger.aerror(f"Error building {self.agent_llm} language model: {e!s}")
            msg = f"Failed to initialize language model: {e!s}"
            raise ValueError(msg) from e

    def _build_llm_model(self, component, inputs, prefix=""):
        model_kwargs = {}
        for input_ in inputs:
            if hasattr(self, f"{prefix}{input_.name}"):
                model_kwargs[input_.name] = getattr(self, f"{prefix}{input_.name}")
        return component.set(**model_kwargs).build_model()

    def set_component_params(self, component):
        provider_info = MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT.get(self.agent_llm)
        if provider_info:
            inputs = provider_info.get("inputs")
            prefix = provider_info.get("prefix")
            # Filter out json_mode and only use attributes that exist on this component
            model_kwargs = {}
            for input_ in inputs:
                if hasattr(self, f"{prefix}{input_.name}"):
                    model_kwargs[input_.name] = getattr(self, f"{prefix}{input_.name}")

            return component.set(**model_kwargs)
        return component

    def delete_fields(self, build_config: dotdict, fields: dict | list[str]) -> None:
        """Delete specified fields from build_config."""
        for field in fields:
            build_config.pop(field, None)

    def update_input_types(self, build_config: dotdict) -> dotdict:
        """Update input types for all fields in build_config."""
        for key, value in build_config.items():
            if isinstance(value, dict):
                if value.get("input_types") is None:
                    build_config[key]["input_types"] = []
            elif hasattr(value, "input_types") and value.input_types is None:
                value.input_types = []
        return build_config

    async def update_build_config(
        self, build_config: dotdict, field_value: str, field_name: str | None = None
    ) -> dotdict:
        # Iterate over all providers in the MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT
        # Existing logic for updating build_config
        if field_name in ("agent_llm",):
            build_config["agent_llm"]["value"] = field_value
            provider_info = MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT.get(field_value)
            if provider_info:
                component_class = provider_info.get("component_class")
                if component_class and hasattr(component_class, "update_build_config"):
                    # Call the component class's update_build_config method
                    build_config = await update_component_build_config(
                        component_class, build_config, field_value, "model_name"
                    )

            provider_configs: dict[str, tuple[dict, list[dict]]] = {
                provider: (
                    MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT[provider]["fields"],
                    [
                        MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT[other_provider]["fields"]
                        for other_provider in MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT
                        if other_provider != provider
                    ],
                )
                for provider in MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT
            }
            if field_value in provider_configs:
                fields_to_add, fields_to_delete = provider_configs[field_value]

                # Delete fields from other providers
                for fields in fields_to_delete:
                    self.delete_fields(build_config, fields)

                # Add provider-specific fields
                if field_value == "OpenAI" and not any(field in build_config for field in fields_to_add):
                    build_config.update(fields_to_add)
                else:
                    build_config.update(fields_to_add)
                # Reset input types for agent_llm
                build_config["agent_llm"]["input_types"] = []
                build_config["agent_llm"]["display_name"] = "Model Provider"
            elif field_value == "connect_other_models":
                # Delete all provider fields
                self.delete_fields(build_config, ALL_PROVIDER_FIELDS)
                # # Update with custom component
                custom_component = DropdownInput(
                    name="agent_llm",
                    display_name="Language Model",
                    info="The provider of the language model that the agent will use to generate responses.",
                    options=[*MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST],
                    real_time_refresh=True,
                    refresh_button=False,
                    input_types=["LanguageModel"],
                    placeholder="Awaiting model input.",
                    options_metadata=[MODELS_METADATA[key] for key in MODEL_PROVIDERS_LIST],
                    external_options={
                        "fields": {
                            "data": {
                                "node": {
                                    "name": "connect_other_models",
                                    "display_name": "Connect other models",
                                    "icon": "CornerDownLeft",
                                },
                            }
                        },
                    },
                )
                build_config.update({"agent_llm": custom_component.to_dict()})
            # Update input types for all fields
            build_config = self.update_input_types(build_config)

            # Validate required keys
            default_keys = [
                "code",
                "_type",
                "agent_llm",
                "tools",
                "input_value",
                "add_current_date_tool",
                "system_prompt",
                "agent_description",
                "max_iterations",
                "handle_parsing_errors",
                "verbose",
            ]
            missing_keys = [key for key in default_keys if key not in build_config]
            if missing_keys:
                msg = f"Missing required keys in build_config: {missing_keys}"
                raise ValueError(msg)
        if (
            isinstance(self.agent_llm, str)
            and self.agent_llm in MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT
            and field_name in MODEL_DYNAMIC_UPDATE_FIELDS
        ):
            provider_info = MODEL_PROVIDERS_DICT.get(self.agent_llm)
            if provider_info:
                component_class = provider_info.get("component_class")
                component_class = self.set_component_params(component_class)
                prefix = provider_info.get("prefix")
                if component_class and hasattr(component_class, "update_build_config"):
                    # Call each component class's update_build_config method
                    # remove the prefix from the field_name
                    if isinstance(field_name, str) and isinstance(prefix, str):
                        field_name = field_name.replace(prefix, "")
                    build_config = await update_component_build_config(
                        component_class, build_config, field_value, "model_name"
                    )
        return dotdict({k: v.to_dict() if hasattr(v, "to_dict") else v for k, v in build_config.items()})

    async def _get_tools(self) -> list[Tool]:
        component_toolkit = _get_component_toolkit()
        tools_names = self._build_tools_names()
        agent_description = self.get_tool_description()
        # TODO: Agent Description Depreciated Feature to be removed
        description = f"{agent_description}{tools_names}"
        tools = component_toolkit(component=self).get_tools(
            tool_name="Call_Agent",
            tool_description=description,
            callbacks=self.get_langchain_callbacks(),
        )
        if hasattr(self, "tools_metadata"):
            tools = component_toolkit(component=self, metadata=self.tools_metadata).update_tools_metadata(tools=tools)
        return tools

system_prompt.info: System Prompt: Initial instructions and context provided to guide the agent's behavior.

system_prompt.value:
# Executive Brief Generator - TAM/SAM/SOM Market Intelligence Report

You are a strategic analyst preparing an executive brief for a product leadership team.

You will receive a complete TAM/SAM/SOM market analysis in JSON format from the SOM agent.

Your task: Transform this data into a compelling, scannable executive brief that highlights:
- Market opportunity snapshot
- Strategic implications
- Regional priorities
- Recommended actions

---

## INPUT STRUCTURE

You will receive JSON containing:
- analysis_metadata (product, segment, specialty, pricing, dates)
- regions[] (TAM/SAM/SOM breakdown per region)
- summary (total TAM/SAM/SOM across all regions)
- funnel_metrics (conversion percentages)
- recommendations (targets, risks, positioning, focus regions)

---

## OUTPUT FORMAT

# Market Intelligence Brief: [Product Name]
**Generated:** [Use generated_date from analysis_metadata]  
**Time Horizon:** Year [time_horizon_years from metadata]

---

## 📊 Executive Summary

[2-3 sentences synthesizing the opportunity. Answer: What's the total addressable market? What can we realistically capture? What should leadership know?]

**Key Takeaway:** [One bold statement about the market opportunity - use the most compelling metric from the data]

---

## 💰 Market Sizing Overview

| Metric | Entities | Value | % of Parent |
|--------|----------|-------|-------------|
| **TAM** (Total Addressable) | [X from summary.total_tam.entities] | $[X from summary.total_tam.value] | 100% |
| **SAM** (Serviceable Available) | [X from summary.total_sam.entities] | $[X from summary.total_sam.value] | [X% from funnel_metrics.sam_as_pct_of_tam] |
| **SOM** (Year [Y] Obtainable) | [X from summary.total_som.entities] | $[X from summary.total_som.value] | [X% from funnel_metrics.som_as_pct_of_sam] |

**Conversion Efficiency:** [Brief commentary on funnel health based on funnel_metrics - is SAM/TAM healthy? Is SOM/SAM realistic?]

---

## 🗺️ Regional Breakdown

[DYNAMICALLY GENERATE ONE SECTION PER REGION FROM regions[] array]

### [Region Name]
- **TAM:** [X entities], $[X value]
- **SAM:** [X entities] ([X% of TAM]), $[X value]
- **SOM:** [X entities] ([X% of SAM], [X% of TAM]), $[X value]
- **Capture Rate:** [X% from final_som.capture_percentage_of_sam]
- **Limiting Factor:** [From final_som.limiting_constraint - Benchmark/Sales/Marketing/Product]
- **Key Insight:** [Synthesize from region's reasoning, assumptions, or confidence_rationale - one sentence on what makes this region attractive or challenging]

[REPEAT FOR EACH REGION]

**Regional Priority:** [Use recommendations.focus_regions and focus_regions_rationale to identify which region(s) to prioritize and why]

---

## 🎯 Year [X] Targets

**Target Customers:** [X from recommendations.year_1_target_entities] [entities type from segment]  
**Target Revenue:** $[X from recommendations.year_1_target_revenue] [currency]  
**Confidence Level:** [From recommendations.confidence]

**What this means:** [Translate numbers into business reality. Calculate:
- Average deal size: year_1_target_revenue / year_1_target_entities
- Quarterly breakdown: year_1_target_entities / 4 deals per quarter
- Market penetration: (year_1_target_entities / total_tam.entities) × 100%
Provide 1-2 sentences contextualizing these numbers]

---

## ⚠️ Risk Assessment

**Top 3 Risks:**
[Use recommendations.primary_risks array - for each risk:]
1. **[Risk from array]** - [Add brief impact and potential mitigation if you can infer from the data, otherwise just state the risk]
2. **[Risk from array]** - [Same]
3. **[Risk from array]** - [Same]

**Overall Confidence:** [From recommendations.confidence] based on [pull from regions[].data_quality and regions[].confidence_rationale - synthesize why this confidence level]

---

## 🚀 Strategic Recommendations

**Immediate Actions:**
[Generate 3-4 concrete action items based on:
- recommendations.competitive_positioning
- recommendations.focus_regions + rationale
- regions[].bottleneck_analysis.limiting_factor (if sales/marketing/product is the bottleneck across regions, recommend addressing it)
- regions[].competitive_adjustments (if there are advantages to leverage or disadvantages to mitigate)]

**Competitive Positioning:** [Use recommendations.competitive_positioning verbatim or slightly rephrased]

---

## 📈 Market Context

**Key Assumptions:**
[Extract from regions[] - list 3-5 most critical assumptions that drive the analysis. Look for common assumptions across regions or high-impact assumptions mentioned in multiple places]

**Adoption Drivers:**
- SAM represents [segment] reachable within [time_horizon_years] year(s)
- SOM assumes [X% average capture rate across regions] capture rate, benchmarked against [pull from regions[].benchmark_analysis - list 1-2 comparable companies/products]
- Funnel efficiency of [sam_as_pct_of_tam] (SAM/TAM) reflects [infer from regions[].reachability_filters - what are the main constraints reducing TAM to SAM?]

**Data Quality:** [Based on regions[].data_quality and summary - characterize overall data quality as Primary/Secondary/Mixed and note source count if available from primary_sources_count/secondary_sources_count]

**Key Sources:** [Extract from regions[].sources - list top 3-5 most authoritative sources cited across the analysis]

---

## 💡 Bottom Line

[Final 2-3 sentences answering:
1. What decision needs to be made based on this data?
2. What's the opportunity cost of inaction?
3. What's the immediate next step?
Use the year_1_target_revenue, confidence level, and primary_risks to craft this]

---

## FORMATTING RULES

- Use **bold** for key metrics and terms
- Use tables for data comparison
- Use emoji section headers (📊 💰 🗺️ etc.) for scannability
- Keep language crisp and action-oriented
- Avoid jargon - write for busy executives
- Include specific dollar amounts and percentages (use proper number formatting: $1.5M not $1500000)
- Make recommendations concrete and actionable
- Use proper currency formatting from analysis_metadata.currency
- Round large numbers appropriately (e.g., $7,300,000 → $7.3M)

## TONE GUIDELINES

- Confident but not overconfident
- Data-driven but not robotic
- Strategic but practical
- Honest about risks while emphasizing opportunity
- Action-oriented (use verbs: "Focus on...", "Prioritize...", "Address...")
- Executive-appropriate (no filler, no hedging, direct statements)

## NUMBER FORMATTING

- Currency: Use M for millions (e.g., $16.9M), K for thousands (e.g., $89K)
- Percentages: One decimal place (e.g., 42.5%)
- Entities: Use commas for thousands (e.g., 84,700 PMs)
- Always include currency symbol and unit type

## DYNAMIC REGION HANDLING

- Parse regions[] array and generate one regional breakdown section per region
- If 1 region (e.g., "United States"), show national view
- If 3+ regions (e.g., NC, TN, VA), show comparison and prioritization
- Adapt "Regional Priority" language based on number of regions (single region = no prioritization needed, multiple regions = rank by opportunity)

## ⚠️ Risk Assessment

node.description:
## **Executive Brief Generator (Agent 4)**
### *Weekly market intelligence for leadership teams*
   - **Purpose:** Converts **technical market analysis** into an **executive-ready weekly brief**.
   - **Core Functions:**
     - Synthesizes **TAM/SAM/SOM data** from Agent 3's JSON output.
     - Creates **scannable format** with tables, metrics, and strategic insights.
     - Highlights **regional opportunities** and prioritization recommendations.
     - Identifies **key risks** with mitigation strategies.
     - Provides **actionable recommendations** for the week ahead.
     - Designed for **recurring execution** to track market changes over time.
   - **Tools Used:**
     - **Claude Sonnet 3.7** for nuanced business writing and synthesis.
     - **Executive communication frameworks** for clarity and impact.
     - **Data visualization** via markdown tables for quick comprehension.
   - **Output:** Human-readable brief displayed via Chat Output component, optimized for product leadership and go-to-market teams.

# Clinical Trials Context Starter

{
  "product": "Clinical Trial Patient Finder for Cardiology Practices",
  “regions": "North Carolina, Tennesse, Virginia, United States",
  "segment": "Independent and hospital-affiliated cardiology practices that participate in clinical trials",
  “specialty": "cardiology",
  "price_assumption": 50000,
  "currency": "USD",
  "time_horizon_years": 1,
  "notes": "A national Contract Research Organization (CRO) is developing an AI-driven platform that helps physicians’ offices identify eligible patients for clinical trials based on inclusion/exclusion criteria from study protocols. The system integrates with EHRs, de-identifies PHI for compliance, and surfaces trial candidates internally so practices can generate revenue from sponsored research. Primary customers are cardiology practices with active trial programs in NC, SC, and VA. Adoption barriers include EHR integration complexity, HIPAA concerns, and physician time constraints. Competitive signals come from companies like IQVIA, Deep 6 AI, TriNetX, and Mendel.ai. The CRO seeks to quantify the market for outreach and pricing strategy for Year 1."
}

# ProdBot AI Chatbot for PMs Context Starter

{
  "product": "ProdBot - AI Product Management Assistant",
  "regions": "United States",
  "segment": "Product Managers and Product Leaders at B2B SaaS companies",
  "specialty": "product management",
  "price_assumption": 200,
  "currency": "USD",
  "time_horizon_years": 1,
  "notes": "Productside is developing an AI-powered chatbot assistant that helps Product Managers accelerate market research, problem decomposition, and strategic analysis. The ProdBot integrates with common PM tools (Jira, Confluence, ProductBoard), maintains conversation context across sessions, and generates reusable workflow templates for TAM/SAM/SOM analysis, persona development, and opportunity mapping. Primary customers are individual PMs and PM teams at growth-stage B2B SaaS companies (50-500 employees) seeking to 10x their productivity without expensive consulting engagements. Adoption barriers include concerns about proprietary data sharing, existing free ChatGPT usage creating 'good enough' alternatives, prompt engineering learning curve, and skepticism about AI-generated strategic artifacts. Competitive landscape includes PM-specific chatbots (i.e. LennyBot, Teresa Torres' AI Interview Coach, ChatPRD, Kraftful), generic AI assistants with PM prompt libraries (ChatGPT, Claude), and PM tools embedding AI features (ProductBoard AI, Aha! Intelligence). Productside seeks to quantify the addressable market of practicing PMs in the U.S. to validate product-market fit and establish Year 1 revenue targets for an individual subscription model at $200/year per PM."
}
